I work nearby and this is conveniently located right by the 6th street pedestrian corridor.  It was a beautiful, sunny day last week when I decided to stop in here and get some Garlic Cream Fettucine to go.  The "to go" counter was very busy when I arrived but my turn came quickly.  The man working the counter had excellent customer service!!  He was very friendly and attentive, offering me a nice tall glass of ice water while I waited and then putting it in a cup to go so I could enjoy it on the walk back to the office.  He had my order ready within minutes.  The food was delicious!  I even had enough left to enjoy for dinner later that week.  The prices are a little high, but considering you can get a couple of meals out of it I don't mind every once in a while.  When I need a quick pasta or pizza during the week, this is my place!
Low rating is my fault I guess for not ordering the pizza. Mushroom ravioli is pretty bad here

I come here directly for their Waldorf salad!  It's the best I've ever had and it's huge...you may want to order the half. Their BBQ Chicken pizza is so good, I've been tempted to eat the whole thing myself...only my stomach would not allow it. The drinks are really good and variety is boundless.  Most recently I tried their cranberry mojito and it was crisp, tangy and had just enough kick you knew it was definitely illegal for the kids younger than 21. Good news: They are opening up one next to West-field Shopping Center (or as some of you old schoolers may call it: Southcenter!).

Pizza here is good but a little on the over priced side but still always solid. I really liked the newly introduced small bites menu. This alone to me is worth occasionally visiting the sweet corn ravioli is very tasty. The concept is very good and the prices are affordable. It was perfect because I wasn't feeling like a full meal but didn't want to split a plate with a friend or watch my friends eat. The only thing that bothers me about this place is I never feel the ambiance or the flavor of the pizzas warrant the $15 dollar price tag.
Their food is consistently delicious and the servers are all very friendly and attentive.

Had lunch here the other day and ordered the BBQ chicken salad. I love how fresh the salad tasted. They have chunks of chicken tossed with crisp tortilla strips,  corn, beans, with a light dressing and diced tomatoes.   The prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is really casual. Great place to take kids. The pizza looked pretty good. Might have to bring someone along next time...ps. The service was friendly and attentive, seating me quickly and taking my order in a timely fashion, for lunch getting me in and out is a must"
Love their chopped salad.  I always have fun when I go there.  Typically packed...and has been since the day they opened. cheers...Steve

If you are thinking about going to the California Pizza Kitchen, there is something you need to do before you leave the house. Take a look in your freezer and see if you have a frozen red Barron or a tombstone or something. Don't have one? Still want pizza? Go buy one. because at CPK you will spend over 10 dollars on five slices of crap. I had pepperoni because I don't get crazy with pizza, I just like the classics. It had no favor! Ew! Also....they had pepsi. suck. The service was good, but it didn't make the food taste better.

The service and the food both were excellent!  We had a group of 33 people and they didn't make a single mistake!  The general manager came and checked on our group often, and really made us feel like valued guests.  The wait staff was ON IT, keeping our drinks full and ensuring that all the orders were straight.  A great meal and great service made for a great evening!

I have eaten lunch and dinner here..The pizza-we had wild mushroom and tropical was good-sort of a pretentious west coast yuppie style-but not great.I prefer Topolino's close by-which has a more original garlicy seasoned flavor-New York style.  CPK is a light airy place and I understand why it is always busy.

My children love this place. The pizzas are just their size although not nearly the selection offered on the adult menu. The prices for the children's meals seem a bit high and yet they do have the most extensive kids menu ever seen. They love the kiwi flavored sodas and sundaes that come with their pizzas. I am a huge fan of the carne asada pizza. I always ask for extra peppers which truly makes it a spicy pizza. I don't recommend ordering a mixed drink. They are medium at best. Stick to wine or beer if you're in the mood for a little something to go along with dinner.  You will walk away satisfied.

We went out to celebrate Mother's Day last night. We decided to go to California Pizza Kitchen as it is "teen friendly"....my kids like the pizza there which is good for me so I don't have to hear complaints while I am enjoying my wine. When we arrived at 6ish there was a note on the door that said "No Pizza" which is odd since it is after all California PIZZA Kitchen. Well okay fine because we like pasta also and they make a decent sandwich. After waiting 20 minutes for a table we are seated. As we wait and wait and wait and wait for our water (another 20 minutes) our harried waitress takes our drink order. Then we wait and wait and wait and wait and she comes back (sans drinks) and asks for our order. My kids want pasta, she says that is fine but the wait for pasta is approx 30 minutes as the kitchen is backed up. I am thinking well maybe we should order a bottle of wine and have an appetizer. Then Wayne orders a sandwich, no they are out of bread and have no sandwiches, ok well what about the hummus plate, no they are out of pita. So what DID they have??? Salad and pasta with a minimum wait of 30 minutes. Me thinks they should have closed the doors and waited until they had the items on the menu. This is a chain after all..........but they did not and tried to make a buck. We said the buck stops here and we walked. What is surprising most of all is they did not TRY for our business. They should have at least comped an appetizer or something to put us in their good graces.....alas they did not. I received a$50.00 gift card for Mother's Day as a gift from my mom who did not want me to buy my Mother's Day dinner. I think I am going to put it on ebay.

This is the nicest CPK I've been to! Much better than Northgate, SouthCenter, or DC. Very clean and spacious. The food took awhile to arrive and they didn't give us any bread! This made me a little grouchy :( My Hawaiian pizza was delicious and hit the spot. We ordered the chocolate soufflé, but it ended up being just a brownie and ice cream. Anyone who has tasted a soufflé knows what a letdown that is. I think when you go to CPK you should understand that it's not a traditional pizza joint, but more of a casual dining experience.

This is a see and be seen place at lunch time, especially in the summer. There is a patio and a constant stream of people walk past on their way to and from the mall. The prices are a little high for lunch, and the food is good, but not amazing. I agree with the other reviewer that the Thai pizza is pretty good.

I've had better pizza for way less. Here I think you pay more for the atmosphere than good pizza. But wait the atmosphere isn't that great either. I'll never go back here. I'd rather go to other pizza places.
The Jerk Chicken Pizza was really good, although it ended up being like $14 including tax and tip, which is kind of on the expensive side for lunch.  Bill Gates was sitting a few tables over.

This is a delightful restaurant across from the Bellevue Galleria Theaters and only a block from the Lincoln Square Theaters. Their pizzas are not your ordinary cheese and tomato sauce variety but the specialty variety like the Milan with Italian sausages, mushrooms, caramelized onions, Fontino, Mozzarella, and Parmesan cheeses, and herbs, or the Margharita. And don't forget their Barbeque Chicken Pizza. They also have a spicy Jambalaya with linguini pasta which is excellent. Their bar has about anything you could want including a good selection of beer both bottled and on tap. This place can get a little crowded, but there is excellent seating at the bar which works well if there are only 2 of you in your party.

Though I've visted several CPK's around the country, my aunt was a CPK virgin. So this was a mandatory stop on our trip. We ordered the BBQ chicken pizza & a cobb salad to split. Both were delicious & we couldn't eat all of the salad. Asked for more dressing as the salad needed it, but the toppings were plentiful. Strawberry lemonade tasted "instant".  Our waiter, Jessie, was friendly but disappeared for long periods of time. The bathrooms are downstairs & inconvenient. Look for a tall waiter who resembles Jimmy Smits - he's very nice too!

My husband and I came here with his family for his dad's birthday last night. Should I be bothered that the real BBQ chicken pizza is just as good as the frozen one? Because I feel like I should. Either way it was delicious. Since it's holiday season the restaurant was at near capacity at 7pm on a Thursday, but we got seats for five in less than ten minutes even though our host said 10-15. :) The service was fast and efficient, our server didn't give us water along with our lemonades but when I glanced at other tables the extra glass was neglected as well. I was okay with that, it was seriously busy and our server was as attentive as he could have been.  Our appetizers arrived quickly; yummy spinach dip and lettuce wrap stuff. The main courses arrived just as we were finishing the apps and it must not have been too long because husband and I were wolfing down food like it was the apocalypse. Had the pesto penne with sun-dried tomatoes for the first time; delicious. BBQ chicken and mushroom/garlic pizzas; also delicious. Would go there again if I was in the downtown Bellevue area and for some reason chose other food spots over it.

My all time favorite would have to their BBQ chicken chopped salad with an order of any pizza. The salad, to be honest, is sweet. But that makes it for my liking. I ALWAYS order the salad. Now the pizzas here are pretty good too. The Jamaican jerk chicken pizza is a tasty one and so is the chipotle kind. I always tend to default with The Works though. It's basically like an "everything on it" type of pizza.  Anyway, this is a fun place to go to with a group of friends or on a fun pizza date!

Service is generally slow and the pizza is just OK. Salads completely over priced and way too small. The only redeeming factor is that they validate parking as long you parked in the correct parking lot. Otherwise, you're screwed.

Inconsistent food is the only thing consistent here. The pasta that was good last time may not be good this time. Every time we go here they always mess up at least a couple dishes in our order. I ain't taking any more chances with this place.

I've never had a bad experience at CPK, or at least this location, which is the only one I've tried - numerous time for lunch.  Food always tastes great (gotta love their selection of pizza!) and the service has always been just right.  Just noticed today that along with the menu, they hand out a listing of nutritional facts for everything on their menu - impressive collection of statistics! (By the way, no matter where you are, if you're having pizza for lunch, you might as well forego looking at the caloric intake count.)     ;-) Outdoor seating is a new addition this past year and it's great - some covered with heaters overhead for chillier evenings/days and the other half of the outdoor seating is uncovered.  Very relaxing and great for people watching (both by those dining and those walking by).
Ordered a chicken Caesar salad to go and it took 50 minutes to get it. Thanks for eating into my entire lunch break. Do not come here if you're on a time sensitive schedule.

The manager on duty, Cody, was absolutely amazing. She was so friendly and helpful, and really cared making sure our party was happy. She went well out of her way to help us out, and was truly passionate about her job. Thank you so much Cody!! You're the best.

First of all, I'm not much of a pizza person. I'll crave it..maybe...twice a year. But this place was AMAZING! I've been to all the other restaurants around CPK but never this one and I'm glad I did! My girlfriends just ordered for me since they use to come here all the time so I just went with the flow, not expecting much. On the drink menu, the apple berry? sangria caught my eye and my girlfriends and I LOVED IT! AMAZING! but then again...I love sangrias, hahaha.  Here is what we ordered:   Kung Pao Spaghetti: SO GOOD! loved all the flavors.. But it was a little burnt..:( Original Chopped Salad: It was great. Went well with all the other flavors that were going around.  Chipotle Chicken Pizza: Very good. Loved the corn mix on top.  Chocolate Souffle Cake: It was okay. The ice cream was said to be haggindaz...but it didn't seem like it.. Overall, my experience here was good. The portions seem a little ridiculous for the price but ...it seemed worth it. Our waitress was good too but it seemed like it got harder and harder to find her if we needed something. Will be back for the Spaghetti and Sangriaassss! :)

Went Friday after work.  It was around 5:00 pm.  Not many people.  Took forever to get service.  Finally the waiter came.  Inquired about the drinks. He didn't even know the prices. Finally he came back with the information.  Ordered the agave  drink.  Good and sweet.  Unfortunately it was brought to me 15 minutes later along with the soup.  The waiter must have detected my annoyance as he said something about the bar taking their time.  The pea soup lacked seasoning.  The pasta dish with shrimp and chicken was tasty.  No water, no checking back withe....nothing.  I waived for the bill....and he came running.  Bill $36.....can you believe it?   Go to Lot 3!!!!! Better service, better price and better food.

Coming to this place is such a guilty pleasure. It's one of those places that you and your friends talk about and think "Ohh, well I guess if you can't think of anywhere else, we can go to CPK." And secretly everyone is happy about it. But no one admits it. The pizza is great! Garlic chicken. BBQ Chicken. All good. The salads are good. The appetizers are really good...I like the tortilla soup and the chicken dumplings. Odd place to order dumplings, but they rock! Pasta is good, too! They have some Asian-ish stuff that is satisfying. Some traditional stuff that's good, too. The Thai Linguine is my favorite! It's a little spicy, but not too much. Very flavorful and a huge portion that will last for days! Service is hit or miss. Ambiance is nothing to write home about. I've had some apathetic servers here and then the gung-ho ones who are trying to upsell everything on the menu. Pretty typical.
There is something for everyone in here, I like that the menu changes fairly often. If they ever get rid of that Miso Shrimp Salad I may just die though....

For a chain, this place is not bad, I always enjoy their fresh salads, the Cobb was good and the half salad is big enough for 2!  Only thing I thought odd is that a full salad is $13 but for a half its $10.  If you're only getting half, why is it not half the price?!?!? Odd!  I thought the service here was just ok, could be better, I walked in the door and there was no one there to greet you and no sign that said seat yourself so you're not real sure what to do at first...and a couple of the wait staff seemed to walk right past me and not even say anything...

CPK's outside of California just don't seem as good. example: back in Cali, my favorite go-to lunch order was a half order of a waldorf salad with the vinaigrette dressing and an arnold palmer.  when i was in boston, the waiter asked me what an arnold palmer was.  come on!! i know arnold palmer's are not just a cali thing!!  not to mention the arnold palmer espn commercial that aired a couple years later... anyway, the salads there just weren't as good.  i don't know why.  they use the same ingredients, and same proportions, i'm sure, but they just don't make my mouth as happy.  same thing here in bellevue.  just not as good as it is back home.  maybe it's an emotional thing for me- i'm missing cali? ok moving on.  the korean bbq tacos are worth eating- sauce is a little strong (sweet and salty), but still good.  haven't tried any of the pizzas here, but i always liked CPK pizzas before. so far i've only been here on my own, so i usually just sit at the bar to get quick service, but the last time i was there, the bar waiter disappeared for 15 minutes- conveniently while i was trying to pay and get out of there!  while he was away doing who-knows-what, i couldn't get anyone else's attention!!  there were wait-staff on hand, asking each other where my server was because they noticed him missing, but they would not come over to see if i needed help even after i tried making eye contact and waving at them! LOL, it must've been a funny scene to an observer.  anyway, so not the best service here, either, but the food is more or less what you'd get at any other CPK.

California Pizza Kitchen has jumped the shark. Don't bother. They've moved away from their old delicious pizzas and now pizza seems like almost an afterthought on their menu or something they're ashamed of. They've moved to traditional pizzas like "Canadian bacon & pineapple" and other standard toppings. For this type of pizza surely every city has many better restaurants than CPK.  In the past they had many innovative pizzas. At one time I used to love the Philly cheese steak pizza, the carne asada pizza, the buffalo chicken pizza, and the greek pizza. All of these pizzas have been removed from the menu over the years and have been replaced with boring versions of traditional topping pizzas. There is one good remaining pizza, the California club, but I don't think it's worth going to the restaurant for that particular pizza when that's the only interesting one left.  The Jamaican Jerk pizza is still there but that's just not a good tasting pizza. It sounds like it should be good, but it isn't. It's like if you mixed Aunt Jemima syrup and habanero peppers and put them on a pizza. It's like Aunt Jemima is finally getting revenge on your tongue for allowing the negative stereotype to continue. The BBQ chicken is good, but the frozen one is almost as good (which is actually pretty amazing to me) so just go to the grocery store and pay half the price or less. So unless you're really into the salmon or the tacos or whatever it is CPK has replaced pizza with that week, try another restaurant.
The pasta is cooked well - just right. Kids loved the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken. You may need to park in a paid parking lot if driving. On weekends, it's $5.

I ate leftovers from CPK last night, and they were still AMAZING! I was hungry by around 5:30 pm, and decided to have a snack.  I grabbed the BBQ chicken pizza from the fridge, and slid it into the toaster oven.  In no time, it was done! The crust was still legit.  The cheese was nice and melted, YUM!  The chicken actually tasted better the 2nd day.  Sauce was lovely, and the red onions gave it a subtle kick. As a part of my dinner, I ate the remaining goat cheese pizza and Thai tortilla spring roll.  The pizza was still awesome, caramelized onions= LOVE.  Like the chicken on the BBQ pizza, the spring roll tasted better, the 2nd day.  Who knows why? Overall, CPK was a great experience, and I am definitely going back!
Nothing special about this place, just another chain  that is similar to the Olive Garden serving average food at high prices.

Here's the thing....I like CPK, but I don't like this location from the beginning because their bathrooms were GROSS!  Nasty, ew, dirty!  I would think a restaurant chain like CPK would have someone (not the wait staff) cleaning the bathrooms?  I just don't get it! Luckily our waitress was very nice and she kept us hydrated while we waited a very long time for our pizza.  The mediterranean and thai spring rolls are yummy, the garlic pizza was kinda dry. I'm disappointed because CPK is usually good, but this store is "eh"

Good food with a broad menu to suit a lot of different tastes.  Service at this location was fast and courteous despite it being very busy.  Watch the ice levels in the drinks as refills are likely to be more ice than fluid.  Parking needs validation otherwise five stars.

Had lunch here today with Maritess.  Just because it is one of the few kid friendly places in Blahvue. I ordered the Thai Chicken Pizza & my little guy had part of a blue crayon & the Mac & Cheese.  The Thai Chicken Pizza was pretty good.  It had a unique flavor.  Last time I ate here we had a Pepperoni & Sausage pizza minus the Pepperoni, and it was sub par.  My guess is that if you are going to go to CPK for pizza, order some type of pizza that you wouldn't typically order.  (I was teetering between getting the BBQ Chicken & the Thai Chicken & opted for the Thai Chicken.  Well, duh.  Obviously.) The Mac & Cheese for the little guy was the star of the afternoon though.  It shone through & helped CPK go up a star too.  It comes with a beverage, and we also paid $.49 more for edamame in it.  The reason I had to get the Mac & Cheese for the little guy is because I heard that it was really good on the Men's Room on KISW.  I thought it was better than my pizza.  : )  Maritess thought it was so good that she ordered one for herself.  : ) The service was ok.  Our server was a bit inattentive, but the service wasn't terrible.  It wasn't great either.  But, I can't knock CPK too much because they _are_ kid friendly. I will definitely go back sometime.  If for anything, at least a trip for their Mac & Cheese!

My kids love this place! They get their kids activity paper with crayons and they love the kids menu.  Mac&Cheese w/ chicken! Kids dessert is great too. We always get the Chinese chicken salad, lettuce wraps, and Jamaican jerk chicken pizza. Yum!!

Had a great lunch here today, service was quick and polite.  The food was pretty delicious, I highly recommend the brussel sprout and bacon flat bread, wow its light, small portions and such a great combo!  Also the BBQ chicken salad was very nice too, light yet tasty!  Thanks for a great lunch today, keep up the good work and if you are in Bellevue, check this place out!

I was a fan until my last couple of experiences. They recently changed closing time on weeknights to 9pm.  Just tried to place a takeout order around 8:10pm and was told the cutoff time is 8:15pm so no luck.  ???  Apparently telling time and math are not their strong suit.  If the real cutoff time is 8pm, just say so - don't argue with a customer until it's actually the cutoff time.  This is a disappointment - the food here is pretty good and the servers and takeout folks at least used to be nice.

Meh.  Is about all I can say.  I enjoyed the margarita pizza, spinach dip was blah, restaurant was overall felt dirty, and restroom was dirty.  Employees have a table in corner they have deemed theirs so that was a site.  Service as okay but no one seemed even a little happy to be there.

Every single time I come here, I have experienced terrible service. I have left here many times giving the server no tip because of bad attitude and lack of attention. Being a server myself, I am not hard to please when it comes to service. The artichoke dip however was only slightly warm and the tortilla chips were stale. I ended the day having food poisoning. Avoid at all costs.
Taste like a normal pizza place nothing special over priced. Customer service was okay. I would go back again if someone wanted to go I wouldn't go by myself or recommend to anyone.

Hey its CPK.  Upside its in the very nice town of Bellevue, WA Downside it has an "honor system" parking lot outside which is confusing for even the most seasoned city parker. Same menu, service, and food you get at all CPKs which is nothing to write home nor complain about - just fine, just fine.

Another chain pizza..... FOOD: Got the California Club Pizza and Thai Crunch Salad.  Went here because it was last minute and convenient. The food was less than average, I don't even want to describe it right now. SERVICE:  The service thought. Seriously? Our witness was kind and friendly but our food took over an hour to get out after we ordered.  A party of two with ONE PIZZA and ONE SALAD should not take over a hour to be served.  There were other parties around us 2-4 per table and their got their food before us. They were seated after we ordered and they still managed to serve their food and not us was absurd.  I felt like we were going to be there all day.  If it wasn't for my friend, I would have just walked out of there.  Also, this was lunch time and there weren't that many people in the whole restaurant. PRESENTATION:  Presentation of the food was alright, but the taste was meh.   LOCATION:  It has it's own parking lot which is a plus. WOULD I COME BACK: No. ADVICE: I'll rather have Mod pizza.

Average pizza and salad at above average prices.  Here are my likes and dislikes: Carmel Peach salad - decent salad with gorganzola cheese crumbles and peach slices.  Pretty decent but the they gotta take it easy on the dressing and please give more peaches, don't be stingy! Jamaican Jerk pizza - sauce is spicy but "over the top" sweet.  After 2 bites, I could not take it anymore!  Avoid at all costs. Sicilian pizza - simple and probably most enjoyable for me.  The light, thin crust works well with the meat only toppings.  I would ask them for a side of haberano salsa that normally is given with the carnitas pizza for that kick! Carnitas pizza - I asked for extra crispy.  Pizza dough thick and NOT crispy.  Pork topping does not impress bordering bland.   So for me:  Stick to the salad and their thin crust Sicilian pizza.

This downtown location is central, relatively inexpensive and validates parking so it is convenient when I travel to Bellevue. One would expect  that a well-known and successful chain restaurant like CPK would adhere to the same food freshness and  preparation standards in all their locations. This is the third and very last time I will order anything from this CPK location.  Each time I have ordered a salad, the lettuce and arugula have been visibly spoiled -- yellowed, curled or spotted.  I can't recommend this restaurant. Food -  grossly disappointing and not up to CPK standards. Service - Average Parking - Convenient and validated when dining at CPK

Happy Veterans Day, everybody! It is because of this special day that I am reviewing CPK. Military personnel get a free pizza and drink here on this day. That's definitely not my primary reason for being a soldier, but I really appreciate this kind of deal! I also feel like service was especially good because of my status, and it's nice to see people so thankful for the men and women in uniform. I ordered a Sicilian pizza, and the rest of my family ordered a Hawaiian barbecue chicken to share. The waitress told us that we could always get more later, and that the pizzas don't take very long to make. That was a surprisingly accurate statement. In a few minutes, they brought out slices of bread and butter as an appetizer. The pizzas came only a few minutes after that, and they were a bit better than what I was expecting. In terms of quality, it's a little above average, but it's still just pizza. I think I actually liked the pizza that I didn't order more; the Hawaiian barbecue chicken pizza was an interesting blend of pineapple, barbecue sauce, and chicken. It's no surprise given the name, but I liked how it was less generic. The Sicilian pizza had a saltier flavor with the salami and ham. I feel like it's not quite worth the fourteen-dollar price tag that I would have paid, but it's still not bad. I don't want to give five stars because it's nothing exceptional. Pizza is more or less the same across the board, but here it feels a little less greasy and the service is good. I also got a voucher for another free pizza on a later visit, and I honestly wasn't expecting that because none of the advertisements mentioned it. I guess they really liked me, and that's fair because I like them!

Pizza GOOD Pasta GOOD Salads GOOD Price GOOD hmm over all. 4 star! i can't complain. Plus during the summer.. they give you suprise discount coupons on your next return :D I'm a big fan of their regular pizza's and their speciality pizza's! mmm salad on a pizza  is delicous! and so is their sicilian. I have also tried their Thai Chopped Salad. Its like.. if eating healthy, tastes this good.. sign me up!! Pasta was delicious too. So all in  all.. so many choices.. and everything is delicious XD Bellevue location : love the large windows the incases the entire space! Sooo much sun! and the service is always friendly and fast! :) mmm mmm

I've been dining here once or twice a year over many years in the past. The food tastes good and drinks are decent too. I never really tried their desert so I have nothing to say about them. Services are decent and I don't remember last time I had any bad experience here. The issue comes down the the value. I think the food and drinks are overpriced for the quality and the amount you get. So I feel like I spent more money than what's worth here. I still dine here but usually not a place that comes on top of the list to dine in Bellevue Downtown.

We have been to this particular CPK twice now. The first time we had pizza and cocktails, we felt the pizza was okay-ish.....the strawberry basil martinis were really good though. The second time we wanted to try something other than pizza, so went for their pastas - wifey had the Four Cheese Ravioli and I had the Jambalaya Fettucini - both were great-tasting and we thoroughly enjoyed our food - portions were good too. For appetizers we had the shaved mushroom n spinach and lettuce wraps, along with a couple of Mai Tais.....wrapping it up with the delicious pumpkin cheesecake! We thoroughly enjoyed our food.....and will definitely be back again!

Saturday afternoon, about 12:50. Seated promptly. Food chunks still on the table, needed to be scrubbed off. After 15 minutes wait, one visit by the host to take drink order that never came no waiter or waitress came by, we left. I will not go back.

Went here for lunch on a Sunday. Service was good. The frozen peach lemonade was delicious. The pizza was ehh.. I probably wouldn't ever come back here, I have had better pizza. Sorry Cali pizza, I wanted to like you, I just don't :/

The service and food here are so consistently great! They let you modify what is on the menu without a complaint, and always get it right! Every server we have had is attentive and friendly! AND convenient, free parking!
Ordered online and called to ask the sizes and the clerk stated they are all 12''. The pizzas arrived half the size and did not taste great.
Excellent service, super fast food and GREAT PIZZA. Huge portions for toppings and so, so fresh. Would come back again and again. Reasonable prices, too.

I love this place. I travel from kitsap to eat here on the weekends. I always order their lettuce wraps, barbecue chicken pizza and butter cake to end the meal. The staff are always very nice as well.

Why would you come here? Food is fine but not worth coming back, as well as the prices. If you want good pizza, go to a pizza place. If you want good pasta, go to a real Italian restaurant. You'll be overpaying for really low quality food with flavors that weren't really worked through. This is one of those places I don't see existing in 5 years from now.

The worst staff of all time. I placed a to-go order, asked to substitute chicken.. checked with them again when I was there for pickup. But after coming home, I see then haven't substituted chicken and we have to throw that pizza away.  Next time we went to eat at the restaurant itself hoping it would be better. We asked our waiter for bread to start with. He didn't bring it the first time. We went ahead ordered appetizers and drinks and mentioned we didn't get bread yet for the table. He wouldn't bring it then yet. My husband who was a die-hard fan of their bread asked the waiter to bring it again. He finally brings bread when we are about to complete our main course. We told him, we asked it three times and how come it took so much time. His response was "YOU HAVE IT NOW, DONT YOU" with a shitty attitude. Needless to say, we never went there again.

I used to rate this place a 6 star, now, I will not even give this place a 1 star, but I HAD to in order to post. I have been going to CPK since I lived in CA in 1989. That was the first time I was introduced, and loved it! I then moved to Bellevue and every time my family came into town from all over the world, we would go there. Tradition. This is my children's favourite place, and we always go there. The last 2 times I went, I find the food has gone downhill. Until yesterday, the 14th October 2017, I will now not go back. I will not bring family and friends there and i have nothing good to say about that place. Yesterday, I was not very hungry. I ordered a little green house salad. I really went there for my children and their friends who wanted to go. At the end of my meal, I was charged a "Waldorf salad" price (almost $20 for a freakin small salad!!!)???? When I brought it up to the very kind waiter, he seemed to agree with me, since I just had a green salad and said the manager told him to charge me that. I told him "your manager SUCKS" Though there was nothing the waiter could do and I was not going to argue with him. Yes, that manager SUCKED! What a RIP OFF!!! And one last thing. The Health permit on the wall by the bathroom is dated 2016!!!!! WTF???? THAT IS BAD!!!!!!!!! VERY DISAPPOINTED with this place now. VERY!!!!!!! Stephanie!

I came here for a team lunch and got the Santa Fe bowl. Service was slow even though the entire restaurant wasn't full. The food wasn't great at all. It costs way more than chipotle, but the quality and portion wasn't nearly as good. The chicken wasn't seasoned well and pretty dry. Their pizzas looks good, so if I have to come here again I might try that.

OK, I'll admit my weekend has not been great. That's why I went to CPK for comfort food - delicious bread and oil while waiting for an loaded pizza with no mushrooms. Guess what I got? Yep, loaded pizza including mushrooms. Sitting at the bar, I asked the bartender to confirm he 1) placed my order with no mushrooms and 2) sees mushrooms on the pizza. He says yes to both.  At this stage my inner demons are awoken by the too often invoked "straw that broke the camel's back" and I ask the bartender to close out my ticket. He does and even though I didn't eat the pizza which was made wrong, he uses my CPK pizza reward to "comp" the pizza for me. What a joke. I pay for my bread, beer and iced tea and head for the door. But... the manager at host stand asks me "how was everything?". Bad timing dude. I tell him my saga and all he says is something to the effect of "I hear everything you're saying". Of course you do - I'm standing 2 feet in front of you, pissed as much as I can be. Cooks  - you're horrible. Don't try to cover up the fact you threw mushrooms on the pizza before reading the ticket by pulling all the big pieces off. Bartender - don't lie and tell me you used my "CPK reward" to give me a free pizza made wrong. Manager - train your staff. CPK - I'll never go to one of your locations again.

Markie was our waiter for my brothers 50th birthday.  He did a great great job.  5 cheese pizza had a lot of flavor and crust was perfect.  My brother had the chop salad and he was really impressed with how fresh and crunchy it was.  We had key lime pie and Markie said we should try the butter cake.  The butter cake is incredible enough to where we got a second piece.  Thanks again CPK for really great food and service.

I came here for the first time recently and really had no idea it existed directly behind the Bellevue Art Museum. If you're shopping at Bellevue Square, it's convenient to park in the mall's garage and walk over.  I visited for lunch with a friend around 1:00pm on a Saturday and the restaurant was about half full. CPK has many unique pizza options in addition to classic ones and pastas / other entrees.   We ordered two items to share: **Original BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad (half-size):  In addition to lettuce, tomato and chicken pieces, it included tortilla strips, BBQ sauce, scallions and cilantro, all tossed in a well-balanced herb ranch dressing. Although pricey, we added avocado for an additional $2. This was easily one of the most flavorful salads I have ever had - it was so fresh and crisp with a nice smokiness from the chicken. ** Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza: Similar to ingredients in a burrito bowl, it was topped with chicken, shaved poblano peppers, Monterey Jack, roasted corn / black bean salsa, cilantro and a chipotle adobo sauce. A lime crema sauce was served on the side to drizzle on top which tames the heat. I found this pizza to be spicier than expected but I really enjoyed it.  It actually did remind me of a burrito bowl from Chipotle, but just on bread instead of rice. The crust is nice and thin and completely full of toppings. Together, all the ingredients melded into a delicious southwestern flavor. I consider the pizza an ideal size for two people. As lighter-eaters, between two of us, we still had about three slices of pizza leftover to take home. I enjoyed my experience here, but I would consider it a little pricier than expected.. our pizza was around $13 and adding avocado to our salad was an extra $2.
WAY WAY to expensive. It's a pizza place!!! 9ox wine $10.99, then get a GF pizza with salad and your $110 in. With tip $130.... FOR PIZZA AND SALAD!!!! It was good but really not worth the price

The reason I give one star is really about the  service. The restaurant was half empty and receptionist told me that even its half empty but they don't have enough servers to serve us. Why don't the owner hire more servers ? I wait for 35 minutes .The food is just ok not really worth for the waiting time. Honestly I think mod pizza is better. Location is ok, and they valet the parking. Definitely will not come back again.

CPK has really gone down hill. This place is so dirty and gross. Now the employees who work here look messy and unkept. What happen to CPK? The prices are still expensive but, the service and food suck. Will not come back to a CPK again. Ever. Totally disgusted.

Ordered to go a 1/2 order of Quinoa Arugula with chicken and it was $15! for a Half order.  I got to my desk and found they forgot to give me the chicken!  You bet I am going walk all the way back for my chicken.   Told them about it and the gave me a "full order" of chicken, what a big thanks for having to walk all the way back.   Great salad but for $15 for a half order with chicken is NOT worth it!

BRYANT IS FREAKING INCREDIBLE!!!!! I started my night at another unnamed location and the waitress was aweful... so I came to CPK.  Que Bryant and I tell him the bottle of wine I want the plate I need immediately, and can he please get me something in between for my guest while they wait and I decide my order. Not only did he do all I asked, but he literally got me my food like wicked fast. Like I ordered, i am sure they threw my pasta in and then came back to tell me they are out of salmon, is there anything else at all they will make, I say the most obscure thing I can think of bacon. Bryant "oh yeah!!!! I like how you think." And guess what I turn take a drink comment on the fact this place is better and we love it, how we should come here weekly." And here come my pasta... I'm like what the what that is like wicked wicked fast!!!! I freaking love them!!!!

We usually get take out from here and it's great! Today was a totally different story. After placing our order online I was disappointed when we got home and multiple things were wrong. Paid for bacon on the salad no bacon and my hubby found a sharp thin plastic shard in his salad!!! Asked for extra dressing, No extra dressing. Asked for no cheese on my pizza but there was cheese. They must have almost forgot to add onions on my pizza too bc there was raw onions. Also they skimped out on tortilla chips for the spinach artichoke dip. After our experience I don't want to come back.

Very unfriendly staff service. Bad Food Slow service Pros: Downtown Bellevue Kid friendly - they have crayons  Cons: Bad Service Bad Food Unfriendly They have a patio. But if you have a dog You have to eat out by the sidewalk - outside of the patio. Better Pizza restaurants close by!

I would like to review this place, but I can't... Because the staff was SO UNFRIENDLY I didn't even make it through the door.  I'm visiting town with my dog. I tied her up outside the patio area and went in to ask if I could sit on the patio and eat.. I was told that because I had a dog _I_ had to sit outside the patio area to eat.   ARE YOU KIDDING ME!? This is the most asinine thing I have ever heard! I have NO PROBLEM with leaving my DOG outside the patio area, but telling ME the customer that _I_ can't even sit in the patio simply because I have a dog is INSANE. I thought PNW area was supposed to be some crazy dog friendly area. Apparently CPK didn't get the memo!

Came here for dinner the other day, and was amazed at the service. All the servers were so nice and I could see them trying their best on a busy night. However food wasn't that good and it was pricey for what it was. Their pizza was not good at all. I'd rather eat frozen pizza. But do try their butter cake dessert!
Told us 20 min wait but they had 8 open tables and wouldn't sit anyone. Too few servers.poor management!!
Decent food. The smell of the food is better than the actual pizza itself. The service was okay. Took awhile to get a box, check, and to cash us out. But other then that it was average.

Went here once a few years ago sat at/near the bar got the flag ship- pizza BBQ chicken, it was quite good i would do it again especially in context ie/like this is a place to bring a date etc... It was a little bit pricey but truly quite good. Not out of context price wise for a sit down restaurant/w/t full bar. I would honestly say that the bill fits the quality especially in context. I always for get about this place because if live in another near by city, and the Bellvue square mall pretty much eclipses it etc..

I've dined here quite a few times after work. I've always been fortunate to receive great service. I typically get the fish tacos, and they're very good. My only critique is that there's not enough fish to balance out everything else.  Just a note, the parking lot next to the restaurant is free, but take note of your spot number for validation.

Bellevue's California Pizza Kitchen always leaves me with a smile on my face. The pizza is top notch -- I'm convinced CPK is the best chain around. You'll get soft, chewy crust and totally fresh-tasting ingredients. Each pizza I've had here tastes, and looks, wonderful. Plus, the service is polite and proactive without being overbearing. Added bonus: (1) Free parking, and (2) warm, crusty bread with olive oil & herbs for dipping.

Very underwhelmed by the service. Last night I came in with my family (wife and 3 kids) to dinner for the first time. Being a first time customer I really didn't have any expectations but not in a million years did I think service would be that deficient. For starters they gave the kids those kid's menus that have activities but when we inquired about crayons they said they'd run out since Thanksgiving! Having the activity book with nothing to write with made the kids even more restless than if they had not received anything in the first place. That aside we ordered drinks (including lemonade for the now restless kids) and it took them almost 20 minutes to bring! All this while the restaurant was, at best, half full. After this waitress took our order (pizzas and an appetizer) and the waiting game began once more..after about 20 minutes they brought our pizzas out and when we inquired about the missing ( and quite frankly unwanted by this point) appetizer we were informed that they'd run out!!! How the waitress couldn't come and inform us of this BEFORE bringing our food out is something that escapes me completely. To top it off once we were done with the pizzas and asked for the check we, once more, had to wait more than 10 minutes to be charged. Don't get me wrong; the waitress was very courteous and apologetic and I actually felt bad for her but I fail to understand how a simple pizza and appetizer dinner could've taken so long to complete in a restaurant that was barely half full on a weeknight...That said, I don't think I'll be coming back any time soon

Down with CPK! A few weeks back I used a coupon from a friend (which hilariously and ironically didn't save me money but cost me more - good job marketing team, I see you). We showed up like 20 minutes before closing to place a pretty simple take out order. Attitude across the board between the bartender/takeout guy and the manager. I don't blame them for being tired and cranky, so that didn't really matter. But the food, the food matters. And the food we got sucked.  I will say the Italian chopped salad was and always has been good. The Kung pao chicken and shrimp spaghetti was a let down- small and no doubt overpriced, considering the meats add-on costs I think $7 and the portion size is truly that of a decorative garnish.. The most infuriating part of getting home with our take out was opening the pizza (Cali Cobb pizza)---- this was supposed to be the main event. And, there in the box was this little crusty thing with some cheese on it; the toppings came separate!!! (As if this is an effing toy I'm supposed to build at home) so there I am, after raving to my friend about how good the food is here, and now I'm equal parts embarrassed and disappointed. But I build my pizza (i.e. Lay out the slices of tomato, avocado, and mix the iceberg lettuce with its aoli, then top the pie with all this. With my bare hands. Cuz the chef couldn't do it. Because... the pizzas gonna get soggy...? Sure, whatever) one last thing about that pizza, a few years ago it was to die for and one of the highlights of it was the arugula they topped it with, which like I said is now a cheaper mix of iceberg. In summary, quality and value has all around fallen out the back of the truck.  It was a waste of $45. We sorta picked at it and spent most of the meal talking about how much of a let down it was. Never eating here again.  I feel sad because at one point I loved CPK. I give up with this chain *_____*

Went for a quick bite at this location.The hostess Jen was super rude.She mentioned a wait time of 10 minutes which I didn't hear and when my husband checked with her again comes the Reply "I already told her it's going to take 10 minutes and it's still just 7 minutes" Obviously don't expect super quality food and experience from a diner like place but having a hair strand and a super rude hostess is not what I go to a place for.Will avoid this place as much as possible.

Haven't been to CPK for about 3-4 years. I'm glad they offer 2 hour free parking because parking would be difficult. The place is clean, staff were friendly and service was pretty good. Our drinks never went empty.  I ordered the barbque chicken salad with avocados. Oh the avocados were an extra $3. My salad arrived  with minimal amounts of dressing. Very bland and the barbque chicken was COLD!!! With barbque sauce on it which was the only thing that gave it flavor. So I paid $19 for a full tasteless salad. Um was this why I haven't been here in years?!

Wow, just wow. This California was just so bad when I came here. The service was slow, the food was meh, and the price was probably the worst part. First on the service, it took us ages to get seated even though there were 10 tables for 2 (I counted). And they continued to be empty even after we ate and left. The server took forever to take our order, never refilled our water, and then took ages to get our check. Everything that could go wrong, went wrong. The food was way overpriced and was really small in portion. Probably would've went to a grocery store with a pre-made meal with better taste and bigger portions for half the cost. Avoid at all costs. I'm definitely not coming back.

Been to a few CPK across the states, and this is one of the better establishments I've visited. Of course, that is contingent on the staff and if the load is manageable enough for them that day--waits can be extremely long sometimes.  Lunch here most of the time is smooth and parking can be validated to avoid some charges. The pizza is good...not amazing or anything but it hits the spot. I'd suggest The Works or Sicilian as safe picks for pizza. For salads, maybe a Waldorf or Italian Chopped will whet your appetite for the main courses--don't forget sourdough bread.  Personally, I opt for the Ribeye or Halibut/Salmon with some quinoa on the side and the lady usually gets the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini. The kids occasionally enjoy a simple Pepperoni Pizza with some panko crusted Mac n Cheese...then smash a Brownie and Sundae haha.  It's good here. Do ittt.

Great lunch options, no charge for splitting our meal and delicious pizzas & salads. Shame they no longer offer bottled root beer but the quality and portion sizes are what keeps us coming back for more!

I went to this place for lunch. Was clean and not crowded at all. I was attended to promptly and seated. Ordered charred Shishito peppers, spicy buffalo cauliflower and Bianco flatbread. The order came quite late considering their were only 5 table worth of guests. Shishito peppers were burnt with a bitter taste. Cauliflower was delicious and bianco flatbread was ordinary. So I would say for lunch if you work around that area why not else you can give it a pass.

***service can be either great or super slow. There are 2-3 wait staff for the whole restaurant in the weekend. If the place is full, get ready to wait for your food.*** This is my family favorite 's restaurant. I go there a lot. I mean 2-4 times per month for over 5 years. I have tried almost everything they have on the menus. First of all, their salad is the best in town.  I don't order salad anywhere else except at CPK. Super fresh and tasty. I love cooking and I can tell their veggies and meat are fresh. The comp sourdough bread also tastes so good. We love their ice tea (mango, strawberry, peach). My husband go there so often because he loves the ice tea. My favorite dish are Cobb salad, Waldorf salad, The work pizza, and green pasta with chicken(first one on pasta menu) and pasta cream sauce added shrimp. Desert  for kids, 99 cent for ice cream Sunday, 1.29$ for the brownies. The price is much higher now. Pasta can be 13-19$after tax and tip.

I don't usually take the time to write reviews but this was the worst CPK experience ever. We got there at 8pm so it wasn't during the busiest time or anything. But we waited almost 10 minutes just for someone to greet us once we were seated. Waited another 10 minutes to get 4 waters! We didn't even have our appetizer til 30 minutes after we had been seated. The place was freezing cold cuz the front doors don't actually close properly. And to top it all off, by the time the food came out, it was mediocre at best. The poor server was new and had way too many tables so I don't blame him, except he should have asked for help, or at the very least sent a manager over since we had so many problems! Never going back there again. My free breakfast at a Hampton Inn & Suites last week was better than my $60 meal here.
Really good meal here.  The manager Surin and our server Hosea were both outstanding in customer service.

CPK is average and giving a review on a national chain is more about what the specific location's service is and how they prepare the dishes.   I don't like the crust on the pizza here so I ordered the BBQ chicken chopped salad.  It's good and filling.  Comes with tortilla strips, beans, jicama, tomatoes, corn, onions, and herb ranch.  I paid extra for the avocado. Service is ok. Parking isn't the best at this location.  They have a small parking lot behind and if it gets full, there's a paid parking garage across the street. Food: 3 Service: 3 Parking: 3 Ambiance: 3

Aloha Dave of CPK Bellevue, WA!   My family just moved to Washington and we were staying in Bellevue and wanted a late night snack.  (We needed to use the gift card since there's no CPK where she lives) We walked up to the bar (as I waited) and she walked to the register by the bar to order carry out.  Dave, the bartender, greeted and said he'd help us as soon as he was done with the other order.  Which was fine because he seemed very busy.   We ordered our food and I ordered a drink while we waited.  #crownroyal Dave was so pleasant and come to find out, he just moved from Hawaii.  YAY!  He could tell off the bat that I was from Hawaii and my tats weren't even showing.  My daughter remembered him from another establishment he worked at because he was so helpful with her and her husband with picking out the best tequila.  Food:  California Cobb California Club We had one more dish but I completely forgot what it was.  Overall, CPK is always good.  Service from Dave was awesome.

Went here couple nights ago for dinner with gf. When we first arrived, there were at least 5-6 free tables, but were still told there would be a 20-25 minute wait? Finally got seated and our server's name was Raudel, who was probably the worst server we have ever encountered. We had to request for more water, whereas we saw him refill the tables around us multiple times. We asked for a box for our leftovers and he helped us put it into the box, but he made a mess of the box, and there was still food left on the plate. When he brought us the bill, he almost slammed it down on our table, and didn't speak a word. Needless to say I would not be visiting this restaurant again, and also recommend everyone else to save your money and go elsewhere

Ordered for lunch today at work and the Salmon with corn and spinach succotash was delicious..... had a bite of my coworkers plain pizza and it was pretty tasty .... haven't been inside the actual restaurant for years but enjoyed the food today :)

Snowflake Lane has every restaurant busy but CPK took care of us. Table for 7 was only a 20-minute wait. Our servers were great and the food was ready insanely fast. They had a great gift card promo too.

We have eaten at CPK Bellevue many times, and also order from Byte Squad. We normally get the amazing BBQ chicken salad and add avocado. We have been known to get the yummy flat bread too. Desert is great too.

When we entered it was pretty quiet however it filled up quickly.. our server Bryant was amazing.  He was friendly, outgoing and knew the menu well.  Bryant checked in with us at appropriate times and seemed to wear a smile. Service was quick, accurate and Bryant found time to make small talk making it a great atmosphere.

The food is pretty average as is the service.  This weekend I wanted the wild caught halibut meal and ten minutes after ordering was told it wasn't available. I had to have farmed salmon which tasted so bland it wasn't worth eating.  The gluten free pizza takes forever and though the crust is ok there are better to be had at other restaurants.  I think as we have evolved our food tastes, CPK has not.

Why would you come here? Food is fine but not worth coming back, as well as the prices. If you want good pizza, go to a pizza place. If you want good pasta, go to a real Italian restaurant. You'll be overpaying for really low quality food with flavors that weren't really worked through. This is one of those places I don't see existing in 5 years from now.

The worst staff of all time. I placed a to-go order, asked to substitute chicken.. checked with them again when I was there for pickup. But after coming home, I see then haven't substituted chicken and we have to throw that pizza away.  Next time we went to eat at the restaurant itself hoping it would be better. We asked our waiter for bread to start with. He didn't bring it the first time. We went ahead ordered appetizers and drinks and mentioned we didn't get bread yet for the table. He wouldn't bring it then yet. My husband who was a die-hard fan of their bread asked the waiter to bring it again. He finally brings bread when we are about to complete our main course. We told him, we asked it three times and how come it took so much time. His response was "YOU HAVE IT NOW, DONT YOU" with a shitty attitude. Needless to say, we never went there again.

I used to rate this place a 6 star, now, I will not even give this place a 1 star, but I HAD to in order to post. I have been going to CPK since I lived in CA in 1989. That was the first time I was introduced, and loved it! I then moved to Bellevue and every time my family came into town from all over the world, we would go there. Tradition. This is my children's favourite place, and we always go there. The last 2 times I went, I find the food has gone downhill. Until yesterday, the 14th October 2017, I will now not go back. I will not bring family and friends there and i have nothing good to say about that place. Yesterday, I was not very hungry. I ordered a little green house salad. I really went there for my children and their friends who wanted to go. At the end of my meal, I was charged a "Waldorf salad" price (almost $20 for a freakin small salad!!!)???? When I brought it up to the very kind waiter, he seemed to agree with me, since I just had a green salad and said the manager told him to charge me that. I told him "your manager SUCKS" Though there was nothing the waiter could do and I was not going to argue with him. Yes, that manager SUCKED! What a RIP OFF!!! And one last thing. The Health permit on the wall by the bathroom is dated 2016!!!!! WTF???? THAT IS BAD!!!!!!!!! VERY DISAPPOINTED with this place now. VERY!!!!!!! Stephanie!

I came here for a team lunch and got the Santa Fe bowl. Service was slow even though the entire restaurant wasn't full. The food wasn't great at all. It costs way more than chipotle, but the quality and portion wasn't nearly as good. The chicken wasn't seasoned well and pretty dry. Their pizzas looks good, so if I have to come here again I might try that.

OK, I'll admit my weekend has not been great. That's why I went to CPK for comfort food - delicious bread and oil while waiting for an loaded pizza with no mushrooms. Guess what I got? Yep, loaded pizza including mushrooms. Sitting at the bar, I asked the bartender to confirm he 1) placed my order with no mushrooms and 2) sees mushrooms on the pizza. He says yes to both.  At this stage my inner demons are awoken by the too often invoked "straw that broke the camel's back" and I ask the bartender to close out my ticket. He does and even though I didn't eat the pizza which was made wrong, he uses my CPK pizza reward to "comp" the pizza for me. What a joke. I pay for my bread, beer and iced tea and head for the door. But... the manager at host stand asks me "how was everything?". Bad timing dude. I tell him my saga and all he says is something to the effect of "I hear everything you're saying". Of course you do - I'm standing 2 feet in front of you, pissed as much as I can be. Cooks  - you're horrible. Don't try to cover up the fact you threw mushrooms on the pizza before reading the ticket by pulling all the big pieces off. Bartender - don't lie and tell me you used my "CPK reward" to give me a free pizza made wrong. Manager - train your staff. CPK - I'll never go to one of your locations again.

Markie was our waiter for my brothers 50th birthday.  He did a great great job.  5 cheese pizza had a lot of flavor and crust was perfect.  My brother had the chop salad and he was really impressed with how fresh and crunchy it was.  We had key lime pie and Markie said we should try the butter cake.  The butter cake is incredible enough to where we got a second piece.  Thanks again CPK for really great food and service.

I came here for the first time recently and really had no idea it existed directly behind the Bellevue Art Museum. If you're shopping at Bellevue Square, it's convenient to park in the mall's garage and walk over.  I visited for lunch with a friend around 1:00pm on a Saturday and the restaurant was about half full. CPK has many unique pizza options in addition to classic ones and pastas / other entrees.   We ordered two items to share: **Original BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad (half-size):  In addition to lettuce, tomato and chicken pieces, it included tortilla strips, BBQ sauce, scallions and cilantro, all tossed in a well-balanced herb ranch dressing. Although pricey, we added avocado for an additional $2. This was easily one of the most flavorful salads I have ever had - it was so fresh and crisp with a nice smokiness from the chicken. ** Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza: Similar to ingredients in a burrito bowl, it was topped with chicken, shaved poblano peppers, Monterey Jack, roasted corn / black bean salsa, cilantro and a chipotle adobo sauce. A lime crema sauce was served on the side to drizzle on top which tames the heat. I found this pizza to be spicier than expected but I really enjoyed it.  It actually did remind me of a burrito bowl from Chipotle, but just on bread instead of rice. The crust is nice and thin and completely full of toppings. Together, all the ingredients melded into a delicious southwestern flavor. I consider the pizza an ideal size for two people. As lighter-eaters, between two of us, we still had about three slices of pizza leftover to take home. I enjoyed my experience here, but I would consider it a little pricier than expected.. our pizza was around $13 and adding avocado to our salad was an extra $2.
WAY WAY to expensive. It's a pizza place!!! 9ox wine $10.99, then get a GF pizza with salad and your $110 in. With tip $130.... FOR PIZZA AND SALAD!!!! It was good but really not worth the price

The reason I give one star is really about the  service. The restaurant was half empty and receptionist told me that even its half empty but they don't have enough servers to serve us. Why don't the owner hire more servers ? I wait for 35 minutes .The food is just ok not really worth for the waiting time. Honestly I think mod pizza is better. Location is ok, and they valet the parking. Definitely will not come back again.

CPK has really gone down hill. This place is so dirty and gross. Now the employees who work here look messy and unkept. What happen to CPK? The prices are still expensive but, the service and food suck. Will not come back to a CPK again. Ever. Totally disgusted.

Ordered to go a 1/2 order of Quinoa Arugula with chicken and it was $15! for a Half order.  I got to my desk and found they forgot to give me the chicken!  You bet I am going walk all the way back for my chicken.   Told them about it and the gave me a "full order" of chicken, what a big thanks for having to walk all the way back.   Great salad but for $15 for a half order with chicken is NOT worth it!

BRYANT IS FREAKING INCREDIBLE!!!!! I started my night at another unnamed location and the waitress was aweful... so I came to CPK.  Que Bryant and I tell him the bottle of wine I want the plate I need immediately, and can he please get me something in between for my guest while they wait and I decide my order. Not only did he do all I asked, but he literally got me my food like wicked fast. Like I ordered, i am sure they threw my pasta in and then came back to tell me they are out of salmon, is there anything else at all they will make, I say the most obscure thing I can think of bacon. Bryant "oh yeah!!!! I like how you think." And guess what I turn take a drink comment on the fact this place is better and we love it, how we should come here weekly." And here come my pasta... I'm like what the what that is like wicked wicked fast!!!! I freaking love them!!!!

We usually get take out from here and it's great! Today was a totally different story. After placing our order online I was disappointed when we got home and multiple things were wrong. Paid for bacon on the salad no bacon and my hubby found a sharp thin plastic shard in his salad!!! Asked for extra dressing, No extra dressing. Asked for no cheese on my pizza but there was cheese. They must have almost forgot to add onions on my pizza too bc there was raw onions. Also they skimped out on tortilla chips for the spinach artichoke dip. After our experience I don't want to come back.

Very unfriendly staff service. Bad Food Slow service Pros: Downtown Bellevue Kid friendly - they have crayons  Cons: Bad Service Bad Food Unfriendly They have a patio. But if you have a dog You have to eat out by the sidewalk - outside of the patio. Better Pizza restaurants close by!

I would like to review this place, but I can't... Because the staff was SO UNFRIENDLY I didn't even make it through the door.  I'm visiting town with my dog. I tied her up outside the patio area and went in to ask if I could sit on the patio and eat.. I was told that because I had a dog _I_ had to sit outside the patio area to eat.   ARE YOU KIDDING ME!? This is the most asinine thing I have ever heard! I have NO PROBLEM with leaving my DOG outside the patio area, but telling ME the customer that _I_ can't even sit in the patio simply because I have a dog is INSANE. I thought PNW area was supposed to be some crazy dog friendly area. Apparently CPK didn't get the memo!

Came here for dinner the other day, and was amazed at the service. All the servers were so nice and I could see them trying their best on a busy night. However food wasn't that good and it was pricey for what it was. Their pizza was not good at all. I'd rather eat frozen pizza. But do try their butter cake dessert!
Told us 20 min wait but they had 8 open tables and wouldn't sit anyone. Too few servers.poor management!!
Decent food. The smell of the food is better than the actual pizza itself. The service was okay. Took awhile to get a box, check, and to cash us out. But other then that it was average.

Went here once a few years ago sat at/near the bar got the flag ship- pizza BBQ chicken, it was quite good i would do it again especially in context ie/like this is a place to bring a date etc... It was a little bit pricey but truly quite good. Not out of context price wise for a sit down restaurant/w/t full bar. I would honestly say that the bill fits the quality especially in context. I always for get about this place because if live in another near by city, and the Bellvue square mall pretty much eclipses it etc..

I've dined here quite a few times after work. I've always been fortunate to receive great service. I typically get the fish tacos, and they're very good. My only critique is that there's not enough fish to balance out everything else.  Just a note, the parking lot next to the restaurant is free, but take note of your spot number for validation.

My kids love this place! They get their kids activity paper with crayons and they love the kids menu.  Mac&Cheese w/ chicken! Kids dessert is great too. We always get the Chinese chicken salad, lettuce wraps, and Jamaican jerk chicken pizza. Yum!!

Had a great lunch here today, service was quick and polite.  The food was pretty delicious, I highly recommend the brussel sprout and bacon flat bread, wow its light, small portions and such a great combo!  Also the BBQ chicken salad was very nice too, light yet tasty!  Thanks for a great lunch today, keep up the good work and if you are in Bellevue, check this place out!

I was a fan until my last couple of experiences. They recently changed closing time on weeknights to 9pm.  Just tried to place a takeout order around 8:10pm and was told the cutoff time is 8:15pm so no luck.  ???  Apparently telling time and math are not their strong suit.  If the real cutoff time is 8pm, just say so - don't argue with a customer until it's actually the cutoff time.  This is a disappointment - the food here is pretty good and the servers and takeout folks at least used to be nice.

Meh.  Is about all I can say.  I enjoyed the margarita pizza, spinach dip was blah, restaurant was overall felt dirty, and restroom was dirty.  Employees have a table in corner they have deemed theirs so that was a site.  Service as okay but no one seemed even a little happy to be there.

Every single time I come here, I have experienced terrible service. I have left here many times giving the server no tip because of bad attitude and lack of attention. Being a server myself, I am not hard to please when it comes to service. The artichoke dip however was only slightly warm and the tortilla chips were stale. I ended the day having food poisoning. Avoid at all costs.
Taste like a normal pizza place nothing special over priced. Customer service was okay. I would go back again if someone wanted to go I wouldn't go by myself or recommend to anyone.

Hey its CPK.  Upside its in the very nice town of Bellevue, WA Downside it has an "honor system" parking lot outside which is confusing for even the most seasoned city parker. Same menu, service, and food you get at all CPKs which is nothing to write home nor complain about - just fine, just fine.

Another chain pizza..... FOOD: Got the California Club Pizza and Thai Crunch Salad.  Went here because it was last minute and convenient. The food was less than average, I don't even want to describe it right now. SERVICE:  The service thought. Seriously? Our witness was kind and friendly but our food took over an hour to get out after we ordered.  A party of two with ONE PIZZA and ONE SALAD should not take over a hour to be served.  There were other parties around us 2-4 per table and their got their food before us. They were seated after we ordered and they still managed to serve their food and not us was absurd.  I felt like we were going to be there all day.  If it wasn't for my friend, I would have just walked out of there.  Also, this was lunch time and there weren't that many people in the whole restaurant. PRESENTATION:  Presentation of the food was alright, but the taste was meh.   LOCATION:  It has it's own parking lot which is a plus. WOULD I COME BACK: No. ADVICE: I'll rather have Mod pizza.

Average pizza and salad at above average prices.  Here are my likes and dislikes: Carmel Peach salad - decent salad with gorganzola cheese crumbles and peach slices.  Pretty decent but the they gotta take it easy on the dressing and please give more peaches, don't be stingy! Jamaican Jerk pizza - sauce is spicy but "over the top" sweet.  After 2 bites, I could not take it anymore!  Avoid at all costs. Sicilian pizza - simple and probably most enjoyable for me.  The light, thin crust works well with the meat only toppings.  I would ask them for a side of haberano salsa that normally is given with the carnitas pizza for that kick! Carnitas pizza - I asked for extra crispy.  Pizza dough thick and NOT crispy.  Pork topping does not impress bordering bland.   So for me:  Stick to the salad and their thin crust Sicilian pizza.

This downtown location is central, relatively inexpensive and validates parking so it is convenient when I travel to Bellevue. One would expect  that a well-known and successful chain restaurant like CPK would adhere to the same food freshness and  preparation standards in all their locations. This is the third and very last time I will order anything from this CPK location.  Each time I have ordered a salad, the lettuce and arugula have been visibly spoiled -- yellowed, curled or spotted.  I can't recommend this restaurant. Food -  grossly disappointing and not up to CPK standards. Service - Average Parking - Convenient and validated when dining at CPK

Happy Veterans Day, everybody! It is because of this special day that I am reviewing CPK. Military personnel get a free pizza and drink here on this day. That's definitely not my primary reason for being a soldier, but I really appreciate this kind of deal! I also feel like service was especially good because of my status, and it's nice to see people so thankful for the men and women in uniform. I ordered a Sicilian pizza, and the rest of my family ordered a Hawaiian barbecue chicken to share. The waitress told us that we could always get more later, and that the pizzas don't take very long to make. That was a surprisingly accurate statement. In a few minutes, they brought out slices of bread and butter as an appetizer. The pizzas came only a few minutes after that, and they were a bit better than what I was expecting. In terms of quality, it's a little above average, but it's still just pizza. I think I actually liked the pizza that I didn't order more; the Hawaiian barbecue chicken pizza was an interesting blend of pineapple, barbecue sauce, and chicken. It's no surprise given the name, but I liked how it was less generic. The Sicilian pizza had a saltier flavor with the salami and ham. I feel like it's not quite worth the fourteen-dollar price tag that I would have paid, but it's still not bad. I don't want to give five stars because it's nothing exceptional. Pizza is more or less the same across the board, but here it feels a little less greasy and the service is good. I also got a voucher for another free pizza on a later visit, and I honestly wasn't expecting that because none of the advertisements mentioned it. I guess they really liked me, and that's fair because I like them!

Pizza GOOD Pasta GOOD Salads GOOD Price GOOD hmm over all. 4 star! i can't complain. Plus during the summer.. they give you suprise discount coupons on your next return :D I'm a big fan of their regular pizza's and their speciality pizza's! mmm salad on a pizza  is delicous! and so is their sicilian. I have also tried their Thai Chopped Salad. Its like.. if eating healthy, tastes this good.. sign me up!! Pasta was delicious too. So all in  all.. so many choices.. and everything is delicious XD Bellevue location : love the large windows the incases the entire space! Sooo much sun! and the service is always friendly and fast! :) mmm mmm

I've been dining here once or twice a year over many years in the past. The food tastes good and drinks are decent too. I never really tried their desert so I have nothing to say about them. Services are decent and I don't remember last time I had any bad experience here. The issue comes down the the value. I think the food and drinks are overpriced for the quality and the amount you get. So I feel like I spent more money than what's worth here. I still dine here but usually not a place that comes on top of the list to dine in Bellevue Downtown.

We have been to this particular CPK twice now. The first time we had pizza and cocktails, we felt the pizza was okay-ish.....the strawberry basil martinis were really good though. The second time we wanted to try something other than pizza, so went for their pastas - wifey had the Four Cheese Ravioli and I had the Jambalaya Fettucini - both were great-tasting and we thoroughly enjoyed our food - portions were good too. For appetizers we had the shaved mushroom n spinach and lettuce wraps, along with a couple of Mai Tais.....wrapping it up with the delicious pumpkin cheesecake! We thoroughly enjoyed our food.....and will definitely be back again!

Saturday afternoon, about 12:50. Seated promptly. Food chunks still on the table, needed to be scrubbed off. After 15 minutes wait, one visit by the host to take drink order that never came no waiter or waitress came by, we left. I will not go back.

Went here for lunch on a Sunday. Service was good. The frozen peach lemonade was delicious. The pizza was ehh.. I probably wouldn't ever come back here, I have had better pizza. Sorry Cali pizza, I wanted to like you, I just don't :/

The service and food here are so consistently great! They let you modify what is on the menu without a complaint, and always get it right! Every server we have had is attentive and friendly! AND convenient, free parking!
Ordered online and called to ask the sizes and the clerk stated they are all 12''. The pizzas arrived half the size and did not taste great.
Excellent service, super fast food and GREAT PIZZA. Huge portions for toppings and so, so fresh. Would come back again and again. Reasonable prices, too.

I love this place. I travel from kitsap to eat here on the weekends. I always order their lettuce wraps, barbecue chicken pizza and butter cake to end the meal. The staff are always very nice as well.
The best Spicy Sausage Pasta Penne and Chicken Seasar Salad. Very fast and courteous service.

Taking in to account the price of a meal, this place does not hit it off with me.  Ordered an artichoke spinach dip that came with a only mildly warm dip and STALE chips. If the chips weren't stale, it would be okay but how hard is ot to het crispy chips. And from the other reviews, I'm not the only one with the stale chip incident.  Makes you wonder how long those chips were sitting back there.  I ordered The Works pizza and in all honestly from a flavor standpoint, it tastes like costco pizza. And actually in fact, for the service I received, I might as well go to costco, buy some dip, chips, and a pizza and eat it at home.  Got bad service from the start and it took 15 minutes to pay my bill. I am a college student but I also work in the resturant business and know how to tip properly when the service I get is up to par. I know this server only had two tables so I don't know why he provide such dismal service. The only thing that pretty good with me was their crust which was nice but I most likely will never go back. Especially since my stomach decided not to agree with their cooking.

Ordered a cup of smashed pea & barley soup and the crispy mac & cheese around 7 p.m. this past Thursday as well as water without ice and with lemon. The water arrived without lemon, and I had to ask for it three times before our server brought lemon wedges to our table. Our server arrived with the crispy mac & cheese, which were greasy and not at all what we expected based on the server's description.  We were they advised that they were out of the smashed pea & barley soup (at 7 p.m. on a weeknight!) so we got the tortilla soup, which was also very disappointingly bland and not to my liking at all. When the server came by our table, he did not take the empty plates and glasses.

I go cause it convenient - not because the food or service will knock your socks off.  Go early - lunch gets very busy and the parking can be a bear a it's tight.  But, do check out the Thai Crunch salad and add avocado.

It is CPK, what else is there to say about it!? It is a chain, yes, but they have something for everyone. Literally. My super picky Mom will eat here and find a least a handful of acceptable dishes (albeit with some modification).  Recently being put on a gluten-free diet, I certainly appreciate the gluten-free items listed on the menu a lot more now. Consistent and a good business lunch spot, I always return.
Great barley soup for lunch but the sun is out in Seattle!  Park in the paid lot and get your ticket validated for $2. Good service and very convenient to Bellevue shopping.
