Every once in awhile, I crave a weird pizza from CPK. I really like their chicken club pizza, on honey wheat crust. I mean, come on, lettuce mixed in mayo on a pizza? You kinda have to try it. It's good though. A few of their other pizzas are good too. But realistically, it's an over-priced chain with mediocre food. Some dishes are very good, most are ok, and some are just bad(I am looking at you guacamole and chips). Over-priced pizzas and drinks. It's downtown Bellevue though, almost all of your options are over-priced, chains, and over-priced chains. So, once a year or so, I'll go here. It's aiight.

When I'm forced to look after my little cousins I take them here for dinner. They love it. They have some of the weirdest flavors imaginable, the last time I came with my little cousin he wanted to eat the Cheeseburger pizza... Can you say weird?  I had a slice and it was just like the name suggested, it tasted as if I was eating a cheeseburger, the really have the taste down. How? I don't want to know. I'm still a die hard fan though of the barbecue chicken pizza. That's a must get every time I eat here.   The servers are usually really nice and like most sit down places catered towards kids they gave my cousin a little menu to color on. He at first said he was to old to color, but ended up coloring on it anyways.  Getting side tracked - Food. was good, pizzas usually come out at a pretty decent rate unless they are super busy during the night.  They usually will tell you if they are running behind schedule and you can ask for some free bread to eat, but other then that can't complain about this place at all.

This place is a solid three star place. The food is decent, acceptable, It accommodates a large crowd and serves big plates. It was all going well until a) we got frozen tiramisu b) the server decided to be a general jackass tl;dr - you spend 20 bucks for dinner, for sub-par food and sub-par service. go someplace else.
CPK is our favorite place!  Crunchy pizzas...  Great flat breads... Wonderful salads ever... I love to go there every week!

This was my worst experience there.  I think it's gone downhill.  Ordered a salad with grilled chicken and it was mushy.  How can chicken be mushy?   While they did not charge me, I wasn't happen that it was even served.  They need to test what they serve.  Also, the bathroom was falling apart. Locks were not working or gone on some of the doors, the light kept turning off as it was on a timer, and the toilet paper holders were falling apart too.  With all the choices of restaurants now in Bellevue, I will go somewhere else.
Evolving menu and good food! A few real solid employees make this place a good choice in the area!

We had the chipotle chicken and Sicilian pizzas and the spinach and artichoke dip for appetizer. The BF loved the artichoke dip. It was very good and he even said it was one of the best he has ever tasted. The pizzas were good, but weren't as impressive. The presentation was nice, but the flavors were just okay. We also ordered the chocolate souffle cake for dessert, although it tasted more like a brownie than a souffle. However, it was pretty tasty, especially since we also ordered a scoop of ice cream with it. In general though, I'm not a huge fan of CPK, though this isn't a bad spot for large groups.

The Pear & Gorgonzola Pizza was delicious! It had a salad placed directly on top of it which was a little unexpected but it was great! The Korean BBQ Tacos were unexpected, too! They had a really good spice to them  and were very tasty. But when the server first put it down on the table, my friend and I just kind of stared at it... there were only two dinky little tacos on the place with a lime wedge! It was TINY and close to $6. We also ordered the Tiramisu which we enjoyed a lot, too! Ohhhh and order a Mango Iced Tea!  Overall: The food was delicious but the prices were quite steep. The portion sizes are also on the smallish side. I'll probably come back but for now I think that Mod Pizza does the trick for me when it comes to pizza!

Pretty good experience overall, got seated right away and the waitress was cool. We had  Dumpings as appetizer - pretty good! BBQ chicken pizza + bacon - very good!! Glad I added bacon. Kung Pao spaghetti - don't order it.. Small portion and taste just ok... Flavor a bit too strong.. Maybe taste better if they give you a bowl of rice to eat with. It's overpriced overall IMO. Also parking is free at the lot next to them. (double check with them)
I love their bbq chicken salad so much and I am totally addicted. Their pizza is amazing

Poor value with many excellent choices within a block.  After 3 visits we are unlikely to return, and we live across the street. CPK was always excellent in Dallas (all locations) and we went for 10+ years.  Having moved to Bellevue and giving this location 3 tries it feels like a different company just using the CPK name.  We only gave it 2 more tries because of the location and positive experiences in Dallas.  It is also kid friendly.   The food is always disappointing.  Lukewarm, lack of flavor, etc.  The pastas are pretty awful and I could make something much better at home.  Pizza is average at best and the salads are just ok.  Honestly nothing seems made to order and no one seems to care about the quality.  Everything tastes heated up or like it had been sitting too long.  The pastas come out looking unappetizing.  The service is just ok, but the staff up front are always very accommodating and friendly.  I hope someone of authority is reading this and improves the food.

I was pretty happy with my overall experience. We ordered the Buffalo chicken pizza which was well baked and the spice level was perfect for my 3YO. The service was good overall and the selection was nice. Better selection on draft beer could have helped. Free small plate on signing up for their free reward program was nice!

I am a fan of CPK so I was expecting a good meal and yay I got one!!  Great service and very solid food.  The only bummer was parking, I am sure if we were locals and not tourist we would have that figured out but we parked in a garage that they couldn't validate.   Our table ordered the pork tacos, tequilla lime pasta, and two pizzas.  Great fresh taste and interesting combinations.  This may be a chain but they certainly try to keep the menu new.

I really wanted to like this place.  My first visit to a California Pizza Kitchen was on a trip long ago to Disneyland.  Great memories!  Unfortunately, the food in Bellevue was just so-so.  On my first visit I tried the Hawaiian pizza and was quite disappointed.  Tonight I thought I would try the restaurant again as I love the location.  Sitting outside surrounded by tall buildings in a nice open location is a great plus.  So I tried a salad.  The Cobb salad.  On the plus side, the bacon and avocado were flavorful.  But the chicken and the salad dressing was so bland it overshadowed the entire salad.  Really almost tasteless.  Like it had been sitting in the refrigerator for too long.  Certainly the portion size was great and the waiter very pleasant and attentive.  But the food!  I certainly hope I have tried the worst as I do want to give this place a go as I like the location so much.  Fingers crossed for next time!
I have been coming to cpk since last 5 years. We were served an extra burnt pizza and the server said it comes like that at times and it is reasonable. Seriously?
Pizza was excellent. Ceasar salad was boring. Service was spotty but servers were very friendly, just took a bit too long.

Ate here on a Sunday afternoon around 2 pm.  Food was alright when we eventually got it.  I was in a party of three adults and one child.  We had many missteps with our order (wrong drinks, a missing food item, and he gave our child an adult sized pizza instead of the kid sized one), and it took 45 minutes to get our food.  In fact at least two other groups were seated after us and got their meals before us.  One even finished eating and left before any of our food showed up.  It's difficult to keep a 4 year old entertained for 45 minutes when they're hungry.  The restaurant was only 1/3 full so there shouldn't be any excuse why serving our food should have taken so long. The waiter was very nice and did comp our bill for the drinks and kid pizza.  But the 45 minute wait wasn't worth it for the food.  Food was fine but nothing special enough to make me want to come back.  With their prime location, you'd think they'd step it up a notch with the quality and flavor of food.

I always like CPK. This time my girlfriend and I went to grab dinner and we shared a wedge salad, the shredded pork pizza with habanero sauce, and the garlic cream fettuccine with shrimp and mushrooms. All are my favorites so I was not disappointed. The only slight complaint I have is that the wedge salad got considerably smaller than what it used to be.  But whatever. I will always come back. :)

This pizza is very average. I would recommend going to MOD pizza instead. Same sized pizza for half the price and plus you can get any amount of toppings for free. I won't be coming back as long as there are alternatives available.

location: Studio City, Los Angeles, United States
review: I use to be a fan of CPK. I always got great service, great quality food and proportion for price. Well apparently corporate has made some changes and they are for the worst. On top of poor cooking.  I ordered a full Caesar salad with shrimp. Well usually they don't hold back on giving you plenty of shrimp for the amount of greens. Not anymore the manager told me that you get the same amount of shrimp added and that it doesn't matter if it's a full salad or half you will get the same amount of shrimp now. Which they use to give more for the bigger order. Not the case anymore.  To add to it I tried their new flat bread the mushroom spinach and I'm pretty positive flat bread is suppose to be crispy this was soggy and not completely cooked. It was cold :( I had this ordered curbside and I live 5mins away. I didn't even want to bother to bring it back to be fixed I just won't be coming back. This place is becoming cheap and stingy. They probably won't last long in Bellevue providing food of this low quality and high price tag.
It is amazing! Having tried this restaurant for 2 years, it is still new to me! I love the crispy pitzas and amazing tortia soup here!

It was just not good. They had spaghetti. But could not make it with marinara or simply  a meatless sauce. As a vegetarian, I ended up getting a veggie pizza which was dry, with unchewable tough broccoli and basically inedible, even after I picked everything off.  I ordered the butter cake. It was obviously a frozen cakelet that they microwaved.  The food my friend ordered was just ok.  For the price, it was a big waste of money. I won't go back.

This place is crap.  And it doesn't even have that mouth-watering smell that a pizza place should have when you first walk in.  I have only been here once and I have since never had any inclination to come back because everything about this place was just flat-out bad.  The only memorable thing about my experience at California Pizza Kitchen was that Ichiro, prior to selling out like A-Rod, came in to eat the same night I did and I was so close I could have hugged him.  This also adds nothing constructive to my review at all. Anyway, between 3 people, we shared the Jamaican Jerk Chicken, Roasted Artichoke and Spinach, and Thai BBQ Chicken pizza.  The Jamaican Jerk Chicken and Thai BBQ Chicken tasted almost exactly the same, meaning it was a tad bit spicy and sweet to the point that it tasted like it was candy.  Really?  Which knuckle head in the kitchen decided that Thai flavor is identical to Jamaican flavor?  They deserve to be out of the culinary industry forever.  There was nothing to the pizza other than it being mind-numbing sweet and spicy.  To top it off, the chicken was rubbery and dry on both pizzas.  It's like they couldn't have made it more obvious they used pre-frozen, pre-cut chicken breast that came straight from a box.   My choice of the Roasted Artichoke and Spinach was no better but in its own way.  I think I could have made a better Roasted Artichoke and Spinach pizza with my butt cheeks and with me being blindfolded at the same time.  The artichokes obviously came from a jar.  Probably Costco.  The sauce had no flavor dimension whatsoever, it was bland as hell.  It had no salt on it to bring out the taste in the artichoke and spinach.  Also they skimped on the vegetables, so you're essentially left with a light layer of cheese and horribly cooked bread.  Worst vegetarian pizza I've ever had.  What the hell?  How do you screw up a vegetarian pizza? Instead of being a consistent, quality chain restaurant like Pagliacci's, it's more like a prepubescent slumber party attempting to make pizzas with an Easy-Bake oven in the back.  While my crust for the Roasted Artichoke and Spinach pizza came out fine, the crust on the Jamaican Jerk Chicken was burnt.  It had too much leftover flour on the bottom, as well.  In all honesty, I hope that they made Ichiro a better pizza than what we had.  I would have rather eaten pizza bites that night.

Went to lunch Saturday around 1:00 pm. Was promptly seated. The restaurant was 3/4 full. Waited 15 minutes before flagging down a wait person to ask where ours was. He took drink orders. 8 minutes later, still nobody had come by to give drinks or take orders. We left. Horrible service, will not be returning despite their good food.

California Cobb Salads here are awesome. Nicely portioned and really tasty. Kind of pricey so I only come here when it's on the company tab. Normally, I wouldn't come here since the food you get and the high prices you pay are not a good value to me.

I used to really like CPK but my husband wasn't a fan so we hardly ever went.  He was willing to give it a shot the other night and was pleasantly surprised!  Inside it's kind of loud, but outside there is heated, covered seating for cooler weather (and it was sprinkling and sort of chilly... in July (sigh)) and it was really nice out there.  Our waiter was attentive, but not too attentive and came around just when necessary, was knowledgeable and friendly.   The prices are quite reasonable -- my favorite, the BBQ Chicken Pizza was just $13 and honestly probably large enough for 2 people as long as they're not two really hungry people.  We also tried the avocado club egg rolls which sound kind of weird, but if you've had a little to drink they're especially good (I thought the cheese in them was a bit much and would have preferred this dish without, but they're still okay especially if you like club sandwiches with avocado).  The strawberry shortcake dessert was pretty good - not phenomenal - and I think on a hot day the candied lemon would be nice, but when it's sort of chilly out it just doesn't work well with the dish; it also has a lot of the shortcake and I would have preferred more strawberries, but to each his own I guess (it wasn't bad, though).  The pizza, by the way, is much better at a CPK restaurant than the stuff you can get in the freezer section of your grocery store. It was nice getting a 'taste of CA' on a rainy WA evening!

My sister and I can pretty much plan to have a standing appointment for lunch here about one a week for the rest of our lives.  The top reason: The Chopped BBQ Chicken Salad.  Can't be beat. Extra bbq sauce on the side, lots of avocado.   The service is the only thing keeping from 5 stars - some servers are a bit less attentive than others.  We've had a variety of servers, the kinds who check in all to often to the ones who forget about you and don't bring your knife/extra napkins/water or what have you.

I was craving the miso salad when I came here for lunch today... and guess what? They recently got rid of like 20 of their menu items and the miso salad was one of them. UGH, SUPER DISAPPOINTING!!! :( They also took awhile to figure out who our servers were and we were in a rush to finish lunch. We had one guy take our orders before our real server came to help us. They brought us bread this time but took awhile and basically gave it to us a few minutes before our entrees came... ummm... a bit late, don't you think? I ordered the shrimp lettuce wraps, they were quite tasty though so I'm maintaining the three star review.

Well it is a chain, but not very good in my professional pizza opinion (grew up on east coast). Let's start with the crust... which I find to be completely wrong. It looks right, but it's tastes so weird to me, every time I've been there... not just once. I'm think I'm pretty open minded when it comes to pizza. I believe in pushing the pizza envelope, it just tastes so out-of-the-can and pre-packaged! Let's be fair... I'm sure some locations put out a little bit of a better pizza, but it's all the same ingredients and recipes. I'm not a fan at all, I've tried several times and just don't like it. Really, nothing personal CPK.  I guess the overall dining experience is okay, drinks are decent enough, service is good, salads pass... not enough to bring me back. To be fair, I think a rating of 2.5 is pretty accurate.
I haven't had the original BBQ chicken pizza in 10 years and it tastes just as good today as it did then. Great job CPK!!!

If I reviewed on food only, I would give CPK 5 stars.  I LOVE all their salads.  My most recent experience I ordered a salad for takeout to bring back to work to eat for lunch.  When I got back to work I could not believe the size of salad I got for just under $13.  It was the size of a side salad.  Smaller portions are fine, then charge a reasonable rate.  I emailed the manager about my disappointment (and a picture of the salad that could fit in my hand).  He apologized and said he would send a gift card.  A week later I hadn't received it and emailed him and he apologized again and would send it immediately.  Another week later and I still haven't received it.  I do love the salads, and maybe I will give this restaurant a try if I can dine in, but I am not doing a to go order again.

Still love it here!!!  Great food, great service,  & great prices on wine!! The lunch wait staff is fabulous, I have only had dinner here once & my server was someone I normally see for lunch, so I can't speak for the evening staff.  Robyn, Caesar & Oscar are my favorites & are phenomenal servers!  I don't eat much in the way of meat- but will review things I LOVE here. Roasted Veggie Salad - I get this almost every time I eat here.  I ask for light dressing. Split Pea Soup - Soooo good!!  Has barley in it which adds awesomeness to the texture so your not just eating pea purée. Tacos - My friend LOVES the carnitas tacos. I tried the fish tacos - the fish was good but the rest of the taco (coleslaw, mayo, etc.) was YUCK!!!  So now I get the carnitas tacos (cilantro, salsa & more awesomeness) but sub the panko mahi mahi for the carnitas meat & it's REALLY GOOD!!!!   Wine- BEST PRICES!!!!!  They beat pretty much EVERYWHERE in downtown Bellevue on their prices per glass by like $2 each glass!! I have NEVER had a bad experience here, in fact I've never even had a mediocre experience here.  It's always good!! :)

CPK is the same all over, but rating a national chain depends on the local employees and the friendliness of the service.  Since I've lived all over and now in the SW,  I always thought that this restaurant and the one in Northgate have the nicest wait staff and servers.   Just wondering, but how many chopped salads and Sante Fe Chickens do you think they sell in a given week?
this location food is just not good.. The  dough was not good.. the toppings were not cooked well. will not return back again. Dominos is far better than this place

My husband and I came here with his family for his dad's birthday last night. Should I be bothered that the real BBQ chicken pizza is just as good as the frozen one? Because I feel like I should. Either way it was delicious. Since it's holiday season the restaurant was at near capacity at 7pm on a Thursday, but we got seats for five in less than ten minutes even though our host said 10-15. :) The service was fast and efficient, our server didn't give us water along with our lemonades but when I glanced at other tables the extra glass was neglected as well. I was okay with that, it was seriously busy and our server was as attentive as he could have been.  Our appetizers arrived quickly; yummy spinach dip and lettuce wrap stuff. The main courses arrived just as we were finishing the apps and it must not have been too long because husband and I were wolfing down food like it was the apocalypse. Had the pesto penne with sun-dried tomatoes for the first time; delicious. BBQ chicken and mushroom/garlic pizzas; also delicious. Would go there again if I was in the downtown Bellevue area and for some reason chose other food spots over it.

My all time favorite would have to their BBQ chicken chopped salad with an order of any pizza. The salad, to be honest, is sweet. But that makes it for my liking. I ALWAYS order the salad. Now the pizzas here are pretty good too. The Jamaican jerk chicken pizza is a tasty one and so is the chipotle kind. I always tend to default with The Works though. It's basically like an "everything on it" type of pizza.  Anyway, this is a fun place to go to with a group of friends or on a fun pizza date!

Service is generally slow and the pizza is just OK. Salads completely over priced and way too small. The only redeeming factor is that they validate parking as long you parked in the correct parking lot. Otherwise, you're screwed.

Inconsistent food is the only thing consistent here. The pasta that was good last time may not be good this time. Every time we go here they always mess up at least a couple dishes in our order. I ain't taking any more chances with this place.

I've never had a bad experience at CPK, or at least this location, which is the only one I've tried - numerous time for lunch.  Food always tastes great (gotta love their selection of pizza!) and the service has always been just right.  Just noticed today that along with the menu, they hand out a listing of nutritional facts for everything on their menu - impressive collection of statistics! (By the way, no matter where you are, if you're having pizza for lunch, you might as well forego looking at the caloric intake count.)     ;-) Outdoor seating is a new addition this past year and it's great - some covered with heaters overhead for chillier evenings/days and the other half of the outdoor seating is uncovered.  Very relaxing and great for people watching (both by those dining and those walking by).
Ordered a chicken Caesar salad to go and it took 50 minutes to get it. Thanks for eating into my entire lunch break. Do not come here if you're on a time sensitive schedule.

The manager on duty, Cody, was absolutely amazing. She was so friendly and helpful, and really cared making sure our party was happy. She went well out of her way to help us out, and was truly passionate about her job. Thank you so much Cody!! You're the best.

First of all, I'm not much of a pizza person. I'll crave it..maybe...twice a year. But this place was AMAZING! I've been to all the other restaurants around CPK but never this one and I'm glad I did! My girlfriends just ordered for me since they use to come here all the time so I just went with the flow, not expecting much. On the drink menu, the apple berry? sangria caught my eye and my girlfriends and I LOVED IT! AMAZING! but then again...I love sangrias, hahaha.  Here is what we ordered:   Kung Pao Spaghetti: SO GOOD! loved all the flavors.. But it was a little burnt..:( Original Chopped Salad: It was great. Went well with all the other flavors that were going around.  Chipotle Chicken Pizza: Very good. Loved the corn mix on top.  Chocolate Souffle Cake: It was okay. The ice cream was said to be haggindaz...but it didn't seem like it.. Overall, my experience here was good. The portions seem a little ridiculous for the price but ...it seemed worth it. Our waitress was good too but it seemed like it got harder and harder to find her if we needed something. Will be back for the Spaghetti and Sangriaassss! :)

Went Friday after work.  It was around 5:00 pm.  Not many people.  Took forever to get service.  Finally the waiter came.  Inquired about the drinks. He didn't even know the prices. Finally he came back with the information.  Ordered the agave  drink.  Good and sweet.  Unfortunately it was brought to me 15 minutes later along with the soup.  The waiter must have detected my annoyance as he said something about the bar taking their time.  The pea soup lacked seasoning.  The pasta dish with shrimp and chicken was tasty.  No water, no checking back withe....nothing.  I waived for the bill....and he came running.  Bill $36.....can you believe it?   Go to Lot 3!!!!! Better service, better price and better food.

Coming to this place is such a guilty pleasure. It's one of those places that you and your friends talk about and think "Ohh, well I guess if you can't think of anywhere else, we can go to CPK." And secretly everyone is happy about it. But no one admits it. The pizza is great! Garlic chicken. BBQ Chicken. All good. The salads are good. The appetizers are really good...I like the tortilla soup and the chicken dumplings. Odd place to order dumplings, but they rock! Pasta is good, too! They have some Asian-ish stuff that is satisfying. Some traditional stuff that's good, too. The Thai Linguine is my favorite! It's a little spicy, but not too much. Very flavorful and a huge portion that will last for days! Service is hit or miss. Ambiance is nothing to write home about. I've had some apathetic servers here and then the gung-ho ones who are trying to upsell everything on the menu. Pretty typical.
There is something for everyone in here, I like that the menu changes fairly often. If they ever get rid of that Miso Shrimp Salad I may just die though....

For a chain, this place is not bad, I always enjoy their fresh salads, the Cobb was good and the half salad is big enough for 2!  Only thing I thought odd is that a full salad is $13 but for a half its $10.  If you're only getting half, why is it not half the price?!?!? Odd!  I thought the service here was just ok, could be better, I walked in the door and there was no one there to greet you and no sign that said seat yourself so you're not real sure what to do at first...and a couple of the wait staff seemed to walk right past me and not even say anything...

CPK's outside of California just don't seem as good. example: back in Cali, my favorite go-to lunch order was a half order of a waldorf salad with the vinaigrette dressing and an arnold palmer.  when i was in boston, the waiter asked me what an arnold palmer was.  come on!! i know arnold palmer's are not just a cali thing!!  not to mention the arnold palmer espn commercial that aired a couple years later... anyway, the salads there just weren't as good.  i don't know why.  they use the same ingredients, and same proportions, i'm sure, but they just don't make my mouth as happy.  same thing here in bellevue.  just not as good as it is back home.  maybe it's an emotional thing for me- i'm missing cali? ok moving on.  the korean bbq tacos are worth eating- sauce is a little strong (sweet and salty), but still good.  haven't tried any of the pizzas here, but i always liked CPK pizzas before. so far i've only been here on my own, so i usually just sit at the bar to get quick service, but the last time i was there, the bar waiter disappeared for 15 minutes- conveniently while i was trying to pay and get out of there!  while he was away doing who-knows-what, i couldn't get anyone else's attention!!  there were wait-staff on hand, asking each other where my server was because they noticed him missing, but they would not come over to see if i needed help even after i tried making eye contact and waving at them! LOL, it must've been a funny scene to an observer.  anyway, so not the best service here, either, but the food is more or less what you'd get at any other CPK.

California Pizza Kitchen has jumped the shark. Don't bother. They've moved away from their old delicious pizzas and now pizza seems like almost an afterthought on their menu or something they're ashamed of. They've moved to traditional pizzas like "Canadian bacon & pineapple" and other standard toppings. For this type of pizza surely every city has many better restaurants than CPK.  In the past they had many innovative pizzas. At one time I used to love the Philly cheese steak pizza, the carne asada pizza, the buffalo chicken pizza, and the greek pizza. All of these pizzas have been removed from the menu over the years and have been replaced with boring versions of traditional topping pizzas. There is one good remaining pizza, the California club, but I don't think it's worth going to the restaurant for that particular pizza when that's the only interesting one left.  The Jamaican Jerk pizza is still there but that's just not a good tasting pizza. It sounds like it should be good, but it isn't. It's like if you mixed Aunt Jemima syrup and habanero peppers and put them on a pizza. It's like Aunt Jemima is finally getting revenge on your tongue for allowing the negative stereotype to continue. The BBQ chicken is good, but the frozen one is almost as good (which is actually pretty amazing to me) so just go to the grocery store and pay half the price or less. So unless you're really into the salmon or the tacos or whatever it is CPK has replaced pizza with that week, try another restaurant.
The pasta is cooked well - just right. Kids loved the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken. You may need to park in a paid parking lot if driving. On weekends, it's $5.

I ate leftovers from CPK last night, and they were still AMAZING! I was hungry by around 5:30 pm, and decided to have a snack.  I grabbed the BBQ chicken pizza from the fridge, and slid it into the toaster oven.  In no time, it was done! The crust was still legit.  The cheese was nice and melted, YUM!  The chicken actually tasted better the 2nd day.  Sauce was lovely, and the red onions gave it a subtle kick. As a part of my dinner, I ate the remaining goat cheese pizza and Thai tortilla spring roll.  The pizza was still awesome, caramelized onions= LOVE.  Like the chicken on the BBQ pizza, the spring roll tasted better, the 2nd day.  Who knows why? Overall, CPK was a great experience, and I am definitely going back!
Nothing special about this place, just another chain  that is similar to the Olive Garden serving average food at high prices.

Here's the thing....I like CPK, but I don't like this location from the beginning because their bathrooms were GROSS!  Nasty, ew, dirty!  I would think a restaurant chain like CPK would have someone (not the wait staff) cleaning the bathrooms?  I just don't get it! Luckily our waitress was very nice and she kept us hydrated while we waited a very long time for our pizza.  The mediterranean and thai spring rolls are yummy, the garlic pizza was kinda dry. I'm disappointed because CPK is usually good, but this store is "eh"

Good food with a broad menu to suit a lot of different tastes.  Service at this location was fast and courteous despite it being very busy.  Watch the ice levels in the drinks as refills are likely to be more ice than fluid.  Parking needs validation otherwise five stars.

Had lunch here today with Maritess.  Just because it is one of the few kid friendly places in Blahvue. I ordered the Thai Chicken Pizza & my little guy had part of a blue crayon & the Mac & Cheese.  The Thai Chicken Pizza was pretty good.  It had a unique flavor.  Last time I ate here we had a Pepperoni & Sausage pizza minus the Pepperoni, and it was sub par.  My guess is that if you are going to go to CPK for pizza, order some type of pizza that you wouldn't typically order.  (I was teetering between getting the BBQ Chicken & the Thai Chicken & opted for the Thai Chicken.  Well, duh.  Obviously.) The Mac & Cheese for the little guy was the star of the afternoon though.  It shone through & helped CPK go up a star too.  It comes with a beverage, and we also paid $.49 more for edamame in it.  The reason I had to get the Mac & Cheese for the little guy is because I heard that it was really good on the Men's Room on KISW.  I thought it was better than my pizza.  : )  Maritess thought it was so good that she ordered one for herself.  : ) The service was ok.  Our server was a bit inattentive, but the service wasn't terrible.  It wasn't great either.  But, I can't knock CPK too much because they _are_ kid friendly. I will definitely go back sometime.  If for anything, at least a trip for their Mac & Cheese!

Been in here a few times (at different times) and always have right around a 3.6 star experience.  Can't complain other than to say that I feel the whole brand has fallen off a tad from its former glory.  Still, I have had some pretty solid pizzas in here and the wine specials are no slouches either.  Sometimes the service is on the immature side (what can you do?); depends on who you get that night.  Barkeeps are solid; management keep this place running busily in a competitive area.

Came for lunch and had a half Moroccan chicken salad. Great salad, but there want even 2 oz of chicken on the salad. I arrived about 12:30 and it was about 2/3 full. We just had water and the food came pretty fast. Then never saw the waiter again until the plates were cleared and then I'll was dropped off. Plenty of other places to eat.

I DON'T THINK SO! No "Hello" or "Are you being helped?" when I was standing there to place a take out order. NO CUSTOMER SERVICE! So, I bounced and headed over to Homegrown Salad and Sandwiches across the street. No "Goodbye" or "Excuse me, sir." Faux pas! Normally, I call for take out. However, today I was feeling like Italian Chop Salad and I decided to walk-in and order take out. WRONG! There was maybe 10 people dining at the restaurant and about 10 employees standing around talking to one another. WHAT ABOUT ME? You just helped two people with take out and CPK decided to ignore me. I wouldn't have minded if someone greeted me or said they'll be with me shortly. I'm a friendly   and talkative person, so I know I wasn't the problem. Until I can forgive CPK, I'll just continue to eat at Homegrown Salad and Sandwiches. I hope they read this post, so they can remedy their service process.

Came for lunch after a long time and thought why don't I come here Often- that's right bad customer service!! Pizza is ok some of the pizza dough came across old. We asked for water and waited for 30min. We ordered dessert which was delicious however one of the dessert Came frozen I guess they forgot to hear it up. Their quality of the food is no longer the same.

Last nite when I went over there for dine in, the service was worst, waiter was very rude to us, they bought the cold food to eat and people who came after us got their food early but we got ours pretty late also the waiter was very rude and he didn't care whether we liked the food or not, we ordered pasta it was too cold to eat, I didn't went there to eat cold food and when I wrote feedback on the checkout receipt, the waiter didn't even care to read at it, he just trashed that paper into garbage without reading it and I don't remember his name but it spells like this raudreal. I'm never gonna visit this location again , they lost a valuable customer and if they service this way they are going to loose customers especially at this location. They don't even deserve that one star rating also.

My husband Kelly and I enjoyed great roasted garlic pizza at California pizza. Our favorite was part of our dining experience as our server Tiff with her Aloha Spirit. Malaho Tiff for the outstanding Pizza night!!

Always a fav.  I get the works and a couple double jack sours. Butter cake desert is also really good.  Easy free parking right next to the restaurant.  We come here a lot.  It's a staple for us.  The kids like the Hawaiian pizza and Mac/cheese, but who doesn't?

Went here for a quick lunch with my girlfriend. We had been to the Tukwila location before, but never this particular one.  One thing to note is that they DO validate parking for the lot next to them. We didn't know that initially, and ended up parking somewhere else and walking. We decided to only order three small plates from experience. Usually these plates were a great value, and we didn't feel like stuffing ourselves for lunch. We got the Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese, Spicy Chicken Tinga Quesadilla, and White Corn Guacamole and Chips. The Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese is under $5 and is always delicious. The quesadillas were also fantastic. I didn't find them to be that spicy, but that how I like them. They were probably my favorite item. The guac and chips were also great. They guac was composed of quite a few ingredients, and the avocados were chunky. Overall, a pretty good place to hit up for a quick lunch. Would definitely recommend trying out their small plates. Always a decent value.

Yeah yeah yeah.  Sure it's a chain and they're all over the place.  But the food is really good so it's no wonder they're successful.  Our experience at various venues has always been much better than satisfying.  We particularly like the thin crust pizzas.  The decor is attractive, the service has always been efficient and attentive, and cleanliness excellent.  In general we try to patronize the good small local places out of principal, but I think people who turn up their noses at the big boys (Starbucks and the like) forget that they thrive and grow because they offer a good product.  Isn't that, after all, what we want?

Only a decade or so ago, California Pizza Kitchen was cool, hip & unique. Now it's become just another fast food place with OK pizza. The location in Bellevue is tattered and worn. The restrooms are dirty and unkept. There are few too many other places to choose to buy pizza from. I'm very dissidents and will not be choosing CPK anymore!!

The food was ok but the waiter was pretty slow on refilling drinks and I was seriously disgusted at the filth on the wall that I'm eating next too. How hard is it to just wipe it down ? The bill was not at all cheap , I just figured for the price of the place I could expect a little better service and cleanliness

The food is great starting with the bread/olive oil ,then the entrees chicken chipotle thin crust pizza and kung Pao pasta.They have got the best flavors and absolutely delicious .Try their Red Berry Sangria.Friendly service.I will definitely try this joint again.

Generally decent to good service.  The one time I had a lackluster experience (mothers' day some years ago: their oven had broken down so we couldn't order bread-related dishes, staff was overworked and short handed) I complained to the company online - and they gave me two vouchers for free meals. I really appreciated that they cared. Favorite meals here are the fettuccine alfredo w/mushrooms and shrimp (I don't know why it's so good, but it is!!!!) and the Pear Salad Pizza (I haven't found such a pizza anywhere else - I love it.)  The new bread appetizers they have are good too.  Thumbs up in my book.
I usually order "to go" from a service like BiteSquad and the food always arrives warm, plentiful and delicious. It's not gourmet cuisine, but for a chain it hits the spot.

It's CPK.. a chain.. what do you expect? I came here because my niece wanted some pizza, and although I was craving something refreshing and light, I figured Auntie Charlene aims to please.. "so my little adorable niece, you get pizza!" She had the kid's meal pepperoni pizza.. came with a drink (milk for her) and that's as simple as it gets.  Although I didn't have a bite of hers, it was just slathered in red grease just dripping down from the pizza!  I'm sure we're all used to seeing kids with maybe some pizza sauce on the side of their mouths, but bright red, oily grease? It was horrible.. I couldn't help but wipe her face every few bites.. On pleasant note, I was surprised with their quinoa arugula salad. Fresh asparagus, fluffy quinoa, crisp red onions, vibrant arugula and pine nuts all lightly tossed in a champagne vinaigrette!  Wow, this was quite the treat! I really enjoyed this and was astonished that this came from CPK!  At least there are other options than just pizza and pasta.    Overall, would I come back? Most likely not.  I'm not big on chains, and even if my niece wants pizza again, I don't want to subject her to that grease filled glob that was on her plate.

If I could give this zero stars I would and it's not because of the service or food at the restaurant which was great.  It's because of the threatening and rude behavior of the parking lot attendant who frightened my wife last night for parking her SUV with one tire on the white line of the parking stall.  All while the parking lot was half full.  He actually fined my wife $60.00.  He also threatened he could charge $120.00 and made it evident that he was in charge.  Be very aware.

Want a more gourmet pizza CPZ never disappoints. The ingredients are high quality and the waiters were very knowledgeable  and prompt. Don't forget your parking spot number as they validate and you can get another validation when leaving if you still will be doing something in the area.

I loved CPK specially their chicken bbq salad. Beside in US, I also went to CPK in different countries: Indonesia, Singapore and some  other countries. I have to said though that the CPK in Bellevue not as good as the others. The taste are just different. Very plain. So, I'm quite disappointed cause their chicken bbq salad is one of my favorite food and im looking forward to eat it. We also order their bbq chicken pizza which was ok and their thin crust pizza with some spinach and chicken which are pretty good. We also ordered the dessert, brownies with ice cream which i thought was really goos bur the portion just too small. The service was standard. I still will go eat at CPK again but i don't think i will eat at Bellevue CPK.

Service is good... Beer on draft is great..... Food besides pizza and salads.... Not so great. I had the dumplings (asked first if they were like potstickers,  to which was told yes...)and they were like floppy, squiggly things....   I ate them because I was starving and didn't want to wait for them to replace it but it's a good thing I had the delicious beer or I would've been really disappointed.

Been coming to CPK for years for their salads and was grossly disappointed this last Sunday. We ordered our standard Salads and received tasteless lettuce with old chicken. The gnats and fruit fly infestation only made the food situation worse. Safe to say, we will be getting salads elsewhere at the bevy of restaurants around Bell Square.

I had dinner here last night and although the service was above average the food was just "so-so".  The portion of the California Cobb Salad was ample (my friend and I shared one of the half portions), the flavor was flat, but the greens were fresh and cold so I really appreciated that part. We also shared a pepperoni pizza.  I asked for extra cheese, which we did not get on the pizza., The pizza did taste good, but it wasn't that substantial. Anyway, chances are I wouldn't go back even though they did give me a discount card to use with my next visit. Oh btw, the Key Lime pie was good!  There are lots of other Italian restaurants I rather try though.

impressive gluten-free pizza!  it looks like cpk has procedures in place to minimize cross-contamination, including replacing the wheat slop flour with rice flour (they are actually GIG certified now!), so i was willing to give it a shot.  the crust is thin and chewy, with good flavor and a great texture.  hopefully someday they'll get with the seattle program and offer a dairy-free cheese.

This review is for take out. After so many restaruant trips in my last 2 years (thanks to my bf''s super food passion!), i have my TWO things in any restaurant: 1. Stay away from big chain restaurants (boring food, one size fit all restaurant setting, service,etc) 2. Stay away from restaurant offering `everthing everyone may like or want'.  This shows me the restaurant has absolutely no speciality or very hard to keep everything tastes good.  Finally food turns out average. period. California Pizza Kitchen? this is a place i went there twice in my entire closed to 10 years living in Seattle and both working lunch.  I have low expectation to start with honestly. I ordered Chicken Tequila Fettuccine, i know it is risky choice. The best is the spanish fettuccine isn't over cooked, but it is just green pasta, that's all.  Description says it has pasta, chicken, and peppers in it.  Sorry i can't hardly find any chicken breast chunks, more pepper obviously, very out of balance.  Tequila-lime and jalapeño cream sauce is too heavy, oily and thick that there isn't much coating over the pasta.  Overall taste is blend, not the worst pasta dish i have ever had but far from the passing line either. I would not recommend this place to anyone except you do like ` the menu has everything'

Everyone always gets the salad or pizza and loves it, but I enjoyed their Kung Pao spaghetti. Their Key Lime Pie was good, and my friends ordered chocolate souffle and all loved it. My only complaint was when the waiter offered to doggy bag my food WHILE I was still eating it. I thought it was because the place was getting packed and they needed to hurry us out, but this was not the case.

This is a good restaurant. Yes it's a chain but it's very good.  I would definitely rate it above the quality of an Olive Garden.  Their pizzas are creative and very tasty. I am also a fan of their apps and salads. My favorite pizza there right now is their pear and Gorgonzola. I like that they are always coming up with new dishes. The service at this location has always been good for me.

Their "the works" is all I had coz I never ventured to try their other pizzas but I like this place coz its close to the downtown and the view is amazing. Try their chipotle pizza it sure is awesome coz my home boys go nuts for it.

California Pizza Kitchen is a great restaurant. I wouldn't call it cheap, and unless you have the ability to take an "executive lunch", I wouldn't go there at lunch as the service is slow due to high volume. However, the pizzas are divine and just the right size for one person. I've never once been disappointed in the food. The parking adds extra time, having to validate and whatnot, at this particular location, so there are a few inconveniences, but it's very clean and, as I said, the food is very good.

My boyfriend and I used to frequently eat at this location, however we've been busier and haven't been able to make it to downtown Bellevue in awhile. So, last night I took a couple of my Japanese language partners to go experience some of the more odd combinations of pizza available [although unfortunately we don't have any Japanese style pizza places, which are the best for bizarrely awesome toppings!] The three of us shared a carne asada pizza and a California club pizza. Both were as delicious as I remembered them being from my last visit. I'm not sure what it is about the crust, but CPK's is just the right crust for me -- it's not greasy by any definition, it's cooked but not crispy. It's fabulous. I have been disappointed by the pastas in the past [namely the price being high for a small dish] but the pizzas never fail to please. The service is never "outstanding," but it is good enough for me.
The BBQ Chicken pizza was awesome! The service was great too.
There a bout 50/50 in my book. Half the time my order is ready for pick up and the other 50 it's not even been done. If ordering to-go be willing to wait

If you get a Martini that tastes like plain fruit juice or a Bloody Mary that's just V8 on ice then don't suspect your taste buds!! IT IS PROBABLY WHAT IT IS! Call the server and speak to her about it. She will surely understand what you're talkin about. They do this very often just for fun.

I have been going to CPK for years!  It is always consistent of a large chain restaurant. This is a great sit down place to relax and unwind and enjoy a good pasta dish, pizza and/or salad.  It's all good!!! Great service, always friendly and they bend over backwards to make you happy (at least everytime I've gone there). I always get their " Broccoli sun-dried tomato fussili pasta with grilled rosemary chicken"!!! Soooooooooo GOOD!!! Their "White Pizza w/ spinch" is a must try. AND I love their salads (all of them are great!

Got the Works pizza.  Came out nice and hot. Tasted good but not great, but I could have used a little more seasoning on it. Everything on it was very fresh, the veges and the meat.  The body of the crust was nice, but the edges were a little to dry. $15 is expensive for lunch, but if you eat half of the pizza you get two meals out of it. It was pretty busy, had to wait about 10 mins.
This my favorite pizza place .. I like the service and ambiance , cocktails and desserts are great.. I love their chipotle chicken pizza and Theramasu ..

Nope. Not good at all. 1. The peperoni pizza had ZERO flavor. It tasted like a cheap pizza you could get off of a kids menu at a restaurant. As Alicia O already said, you're better off getting a frozen pizza. 2.The Kung Pao Spaghetti is aweful. It really tasted like something that came all freeze dried and just had water added.  3. The Jamaican Jerk Chicken was far too sweet and didn't impress any of us.  Lastly, the prices are far too high for this sub-par food. My recommendation is to buy a bottle of wine and a DiGiorno and stay home!
Went there with a big group of people. Got great service and pretty good pizza. Although their Italian chopped salad is a 1 star. I'll just have to order soothing else next time. ;)

Horrible experience. I ordered two chipotle pizzas for takeout. When I got back and opened it, one of boxes just had the pizza base with some peppers. Thats it! I called back and let them know. I was told come pick up replacement. Guess what that was? Same base + plus bell peppers with some beans and sauce separately.. Seriously? Why not just put the oven outside so I can bake it myself too?

I don't get how this place is always packed... yes, the food is not horrible tho the prices are outrageous! $12 for each of my boys to have a "large" cheese pizza that is devoured in minutes is absolutely ridiculous. The service is always nice and as I said, the food is perfectly fine tasting, I just feel like a fool spending that much money on that little amount of food. One reviewer mentioned Topolino's which is around the corner; coincidentally, that is our favorite!
Have loved every dish we have had at this retaurant.  The service is always great.  They even have a take out options - I used my Iphone app today and the food was ready when I arrived.

like the stars say....Meh...  we came here for my sisters birthday and well...ehh...I've never been here before but I don't think I'll be back.   luckily it wasn't too crowded for a Friday night (also after a Cirque Du Soliel show) so we were seated in about 5-10 min.   the service was oki...our waiter was nice but he never really checked on us that often and we had to ask about 3 times for water for everyone!  he kept bringing one glass at a time!  we ordered some pizza and some pastas.  to be honest...I don't find a huge difference between the frozen Cali Pizza at the store and the one at the restaurant...I had a Fettuccine and Alvin had a ravioli.  both meh...my pasta was super bland...I wish I had some spices or something to give it more flavor!  My mom however ordered the Kung Pao spaghetti and I must say that that was yummy and full of flavor!  the only thing that I can really recommend... if it wasn't for good family company the dinner would have been a bit of a bust.  sorry! on one last side note I did like that they offered half or full glasses of wine since as most people know I'm a light weight!

This is a love hate relationship where there's things I like about California Pizza Kitchen and there's some things I don't like.  What I like is that I can walk right in and walk by the hostess and plant myself at the counter area ("Just like in Las Vegas hotels servicing the gamblers") without puttling myself on the list and waiting to be seated.  This is great and sit over by the carryout cashier and get 24x7 service to refill my ice tea over and over.  I really like the "carne asada pizza"!  To bad it's been removed from the menu, "ouch" and I have to find something else on the menu that's 2nd best (at least for me).  As for normal seating, I always had to wait to be seated, service seems to be out of sync with when I want to see a server for ordering or getting the check.  And don't expect to get your ice tea refilled 3 times at a table.  My advice is go to the counter area and you'll get attentive service and the pizza will come directly to you without a wait.

This is the perfect place for a first date! Anything on the menu is amazing, so you can't go wrong. Their pear gorgonzola pizza was epic (i still have dreams about it) and their pasta is great, too! The only downside is that their food is so great, you eat to much and have no room for dessert! Their dessert menu looks incredible, but i'm afraid i'll never know for sure because i can't get enough of their pizza!

I came here with three friends and was told there would be a 5-10 minute wait, but we didn't sit down for a good half hour, which makes sense as it looks as though a good deal of the tables are set up just for two. Other than that, no big complaints. I started with the Waldorf salad which was much better than I expected, with surprisingly distinct flavors and delightfully crisp apples. The greens were a slight bit mushy and there was a touch too much dressing, but the flavor was still fantastic. I got the Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza as an entree, which was delicious. The pieces of meat were spiced just right, and complemented the other flavors instead of drowning them out. Then I tried a piece of my friends BBQ chicken pizza - WOW. Probably because it's their signature dish, this was incredible, tasty, sweet, and soft. Service was nice and quick, my soda cup was barely half-empty before the waiter noticed and brought another (free) refill.  The only complaint here is the price - $13 for a single-person pizza is a bit high, imho.

The place has nothing to stand out. It's just typical western pizza. Decent variety to choose from. My "Mexican fusion" pizza was delicious, so no complains there. But we never got our appetizers, our pretty server just forgot.

I'm not sure why everyone seems to like this restaurant.  Other than I used to...  Last Saturday night my family and I decided to go because we knew we could get some good food for dinner.  HUGE MISTAKE!!!! Here is my list of complaints... :( 1.  For some reason they no longer serve beef pizza.  This is not good for someone that doesn't eat chicken or pork.  Those seem to be the only 2 meats on the menu. 2.  The wedge salads were unacceptable.  These I did pay for because we did eat them.  The lettuce was not clean and there were purple egg whites in my wife's salad. 3. I overheard one of the waitresses telling a table near us that she would have to check to see if a particular pizza was available as they hadn't taken enough skins out of the freezer.  Really????  You use frozen skins in your restaurant????  I worked in hospitality for over 20 years including 3 as a pizza dough boy (I made fresh dough every day)  I can't imagine that a major chain would use frozen dough... 3.  When we did get our dinner, a cheese pizza, there was more grease on it than came out of the Gulf Oil spill... Another pizza (after 1 bite) had the blandest tasting sauce I have ever had in my life.  It was almost as if the restaurant didn't want us to eat there and never eat there again.  I told the waitress that I refused to pay for this garbage.  None of  food was good enough to pay for.   I did pay for the salads and drinks.  Then promptly went somewhere else.  You should too... A manager never came over to hear our concerns or to attempt to right the massive wrong.  I did send mail to their Corporate office and was told that I would be hearing from a manager.  This was almost a week ago and nothing. I'm saddened that you can buy one of their frozen pizzas in the grocery store and it tastes better than it does in the restaurant.

i have spent many evenings dining at a CPK in California, but never here in Washington. I spent a saturday early evening at this one in Bellevue and enjoy their BBQ Chicken Salad and their garlic chicken pizza. It was saturday evening around 545p when we put our name on the to be seated list and waited about 30 minutes to be seated...OUCH!!!!  Why are people waiting to be seated at a CPK?  The service was decent and what you would expect, hurried and basically cordial. The manager on duty stopped by to see how we were doing, which was nice. The food was exactly the same here in WA state as it is in California, so thats a good thing for them when it comes to consistency across states lines... If you are looking for a unique flavor in a pizza and good salads that will break your diet, then CPK is for you. I give them 3 stars based off the OK service, OK wait times... the food is a solid 3 because it is just good. nothing great stands out, but they do offer interesting flavors from the standard pizza and salad

Love the thin crust pizza's. But I miss the Singapore Shrimp Rolls! Price is ok.  Half-sized salads are big enough for two to share with a pizza.  This location usually isn't too busy either, which is nice.

Great chopped salad. Extensive menu of pizzas. We had Buffalo Chicken which was quite tasty. Service was good. There can be quite a long wait on the weekends.  Next time would like to try non-pizza item.

Solid overall, with excellent food but a bit too crowded inside with long wait time. The food was the quality you'd expect from CPK (4-star): creative, flavorful and fresh. The location is easy enough to get to although parking was hard to find and the lunch crowd means lunch is likely not to quick. Our server seemed a bit distracted with his other customers as well - my naturally soft spoken husband had to repeat the desert order twice. We did appreciate the elaborate chalk drawing near the kitchen.

Used to have really good service and was our favorite place to eat. Also the jamaican jerk chicken pizza was our usual. We went there yesterday and had the worst dinner ever. The server was really mean and would act angry and the food was the same as eating a plate of salt.

I only go back for their Thai Crunch Salad which I really enjoy, but the overall experience could use improvement.  I have gone twice now where they did not put enough validation on my parking stub and so I either had to go back in or pay for the time they did not put on the card even though I had been sitting there.  I find this very careless of the staff and once I would overlook but it has happened twice now :(   The wait staff is very inconsistent, sometimes they bring bread and are on top of things and other times they are completely not paying any attention to what we need.  I think the quality of the food is fine, I am always happy with what I have, but the front of house always makes me question if I want to go back.

CPK is a standby restaurant for me: if I'm in an unfamiliar city, I seek out the CPK first and explore later. I LOVE so many dishes at CPK, and not just the pizza either: the spinach-artichoke dip, any pasta, and the strawberry lemonade is a perfect combination of sweet and tangy. I like many of their pizzas as well, too many to list here, and I can't remember them all either.  :-)  The one with yukon potatoes comes to mind, as does the one withe eggplant slices. Atmosphere: mehhhh.  Don't go between 6-8pm on a Friday or Saturday, or you will be waiting for at least 10 minutes and shouting at your dinner companions.  CPK is also a magnet for bratty, loud children, which I frankly despise.  Going later in the evenings is always better, for service and noise levels.  Service even at busy times is attentive. One of my favorite staple chain restaurants.

We used to really like CPK. It was a regular in our eating our rotation. However, in August 2012 someone at their corporate office starting messing with what worked. Now the place is no longer a rotation regular and after tonight's awful experience not an even an option.  1. Uniform changes- not a major issue you think- think again.  Tonight one big issue was no one wore name tags. This would not be an issue if they wore some type of uniform so I could tell who worked at the restaurant and who did not. The outfit used to be black slacks and a logo dress shirt of some type with a name tag. Now the outfit is jeans- any color- and any color dress shirt with no logo and no name tag.  Tonight the service was so slow guests were getting up and searching the restaurant for someone to wait on them.  Also you used to be able to tell who was a manager. Generally the person with the tie and the name tag that said Bob and Manager on it. Now it is anyone's guess who is running the place as no one identified themselves as a manager during our meal.  2. When you arrive at the restaurant there used to be glass panels between the booths and the waiting area. This prevented you from having some curious child reach over into your booth while you were eating to investigate. It also gave you some semblance of privacy while dining even if the panels were clear glass. Now the panels are gone and you are left with the curious adults, those who love to ogle what you are eating, and their long armed children to pester you while dining. The panels need to go back up. 3. The food is $2-$4 higher than it used to be. Many items were dumped off the menu or changed in a way that makes it so one does not order it any longer without compunction. The Thai Crunch Salad was a favorite of mine. I can't have peanuts so I always ordered it with the Lime/Cilantro dressing instead. Well, now if you want to order it, it only comes with the peanut dressing. Sorry if you have allergies but CPK does not care.  The Jamaican Jerk Pizza, you either love it or hate it, is a heavy pizza. I mean the toppings are heavy. Why on earth would you put heavy toppings on a thin crust pizza? I ordered it not knowing it had been relegated to thin crust pizza list and spent an annoying evening reloading toppings back onto the pizza slices. Mental note now anytime I want to order it I have to ask for the original crust.  4. Table settings- CPK is not a fine dining establishment. It is a higher end pizza place in a causal atmosphere. One of the changes made were the napkins from black cloth to recycled brown paper. What a letdown. The napkins look cheap and you only get one and have to beg for more. I preferred the cloth napkins.  Then we have two large wine glasses set on the end of each table along with some annoying trifold advert for this month's specials. All items set at the end of dining tables automatically get moved to the back of the table. I know some marketing person claims otherwise but it is annoying and should be stopped. It does not motivate me to have wine with my lunch or to purchase the meal of the week. Trifold adverts remind of me of Denny's and their forever sticky dessert menus at the back of the table. YUCK!  5. Upon being seated you are no longer handed one menu, with possibly a drink menu. No, you are now handed no less than three menus and sometimes more depending on who is working in the sales and marketing departments that week. I honestly do not want to be handed several menus. I want to be handed one menu and have a drink menu placed at the end of the table. Otherwise the collection of the menus is now this size layering task for the server instead of a simple collection process. Just put the options on the menu!  Finally, our dinner experience this evening. What a travesty! I honestly felt as if I was in the Twilight Zone and dining with Gordon Ramsay on Kitchen Nightmares.  Three out of four items we tried to order they were out of.  We found this out at the initial order, then when the waitress returned 10 minutes later and then while my husband attempted to order something different. At that point our server told him what they did not have and then pointed out the two items they did have. Numerous guests got up and searched for someone, anyone to take their order, get them a drink or just show up and say "Hi, I am your wait person". Food took 30-40 minutes to make its way out of the kitchen. Some food items came out of the kitchen clearly ready for compost and not fit to be served to a guest. The guest behind us was told "Your server is very busy right now but I can take your drink orders for them," this after I know they had been seated and waiting at least 15-20 minutes.  At no point did a manager appear and again no one wore a distinguishing uniform or a name tag so who knows who did what under what title.  At no point was anyone offered a discount or complimentary beverages for the lengthy wait time.  We won't be back.

Concept clearly is good...food is not. Mrs d and I ordered a meal for two with included a spinach artichoke dip, no flavor and chips were stale, then a chinese chicken salad, I think it had been made last week...and the highlight a bbq chicken pizza- really enjoyed the crust, the top was over sauced and  limp (maybe also made last week).

Very poor service. Everyone that works there looks depressed. Not a place for foodies (of course, it's a CPK). The person in charge of hiring should be fired! Stay away from this place! There are other restaurants around the corner.

Like, OMG, and stuff. I was totally getting into the new Mika CD and I totally think I'd like a bitchin' slice of BBQ chicken and stufffff? I totally totally totally loooooooooove the Chicken Piccata and oh did I tell you about Marsha and Bill...oh my god they are totally sooooo together now, and Jennie is crushed-- it destroyed her, but anyway, so I love the Mago Tandori Chicken Pizza tooooo its like sooooooo awesome.... the waitress like served us quickly, but uggh I can't believe what she did to her hair!!! It is soooo 90's. Like gag. oh look i got another text from Sasha!!! He is the only bff omg lol. Hey i gotta run and get my toenails re-coated, my elbow pierced, and see if daddy can pre-pay for my tuition to USC!!!!!!! Hugs Kisses and smoochiess too all my grrrrrrrrlsssss. All my friends are here at CPK!!!! CPK forever !!! uh, yeah.

Worth checking out but not nearly as special as it was hyped out to be.   Relatives and friends have habitually gushed about how great this place is and while I wasn't disappointed by my lunchtime visit, I certainly did not think it garnered the high degree of accolades I'd heard. Generally good points: it has a pretty wide variety of menu offerings to suit many diners' preferences.   Service was prompt, although as with any decent establishment, there was a 10-15 minute wait for a table for 3 at 1PM.  Outdoor dining is available, but it is shaded during the lunch hour.  I wasn't sure if this was due to how the restaurant is situated or if it was due to the large number of high-rise office and residential buildings going up nearby.   Food tasted better than average but there was what seemed to be a longer than typical wait from the time the order was put in to the time it arrived.  We had two pizzas... a regular pepperoni and a Sicilian.  And one of us had a chicken lettuce wrap.  For a starter, we shared (sesame ginger?) chicken won tons.  Generally good stuff.        Neutral: parking is validated for 2 hours, and with the wait for the table and food we needed every second of that 2 hours to complete our lunch.   This might be a better place for a day out shopping lunch than a serious, quick weekday, workday meal.  It would have been nice if the server had offered up some favorites from the menu or even if they'd asked if this was my first visit, etc.   As it was, a portion of our party was delayed, so I got to know the menu pretty well by the time we were set to order.   Other observations: while there were some really casual dressers here (like cut-offs, t-shirt, and flip flops) most were office casual and a few were "real estate chic" (flip through the glam shots agents feature with their real estate ads in "Homes & Land" magazine and you'll know what I mean).   The parking lot spaces are very tight.  Please leave the Escalade at home for this trip... take the Prius. Best thing about CPK: I didn't hear one single server sing happy birthday to anybody.   Bottom line: if I'm in the area and have a craving for pizza that's outside of the typical with good flavor and casual atmosphere, etc.  I'd give the place a shot.  I just wouldn't fight through I-405 traffic to go out of my way to eat here. PS... the menu said if you try something new and dislike it, they'll bring you something else for no charge.

I'm a fan, what can I say?! I consider myself a total pizza snob, but when I order their crazily concocted pizzas, I'm not expecting your typical pepperoni and cheese. I have recently discovered their fabulous Greek pizza.  Basically flatbread with grilled chicken and cheese, then topped with tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, kalamata olives and tzaiki sauce.  It doesn't taste at all like pizza, but I dont expect it to! I love it.   My fiance' had their Neopolitan Thin Style pizza crust with their Pepperoni Pomodoro, and it was excellent, even tasted like "pizza". For an appetizer the Tortilla Spring rolls are great, our favorites are the Baja Chicken Torilla rolls! Yummmmm! Another good recommendation I can make is their Kung Pao Spaghetti! The only thing I can say bad about the place is the volume.  Its so damn loud in there, and its usually FULL of kids at around 7pm.  Many of them go there for birthdays, or after softball games, etc.  Its LOUD.  If you go during peak times Friday-Sunday, expect to wait, a LONG LONG time. I discovered their Grape Martini the last time I went in and I totally loved it, infact, im craving one riiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiight now!

I work close to CPK, so I visit the restaurant once in a great while as a treat. As most people know, this is a chain and it certainly feels like it in the restaurant.  It can become very loud and crowded, so make sure you make reservations if you intend to show up between 12 PM - 1:30PM, and 5:30 pm - 8:00 pm.  The wait can easily be over an hour at times! Some of their food is great!  I go for their Thai Chicken Pizza--an unexpectedly delicious taste of cilantro, carrots, chicken, peanuts, etc.  It's fantastic, easily my favorite plate there.  I'm a little disappointed that the julienned carrots look to be a few days old (shriveled), but everything else on the pizza is gold. The salads aren't half-bad either.  But I would recommend getting the dressing on the side as they like to douse the greens in the stuff. Every table is given a stack of white bread slices and butter, but the bread is always, always, always dry and not fresh.  It's a source of disappointment for me. The staff is friendly enough.  Maybe one out of every five times I go, I get someone with no personality.  Not bad odds for a chain restaurant. I give this three stars for the tastiness of my favorite dish, but I think this restaurant as a whole is a little overrated.

Sauce for pasta was like water while the waiter said it is homemade and so good. BS. Childrens pasta dish had so few noodles that we needed to order pizza as well. Adult pizza was so-so. Going elsewhere for pizza. We gave them the requested feedback only to be told, OK thanks. Nothing as compensation.

My friends call me a food snob.  I say that I just like good food. Pls don't tell them that I actually like CPK once in a while.  Yes its a chain and yes chains are evil but every few months I get a hankering for one of their pizza. The Bellevue location seems to do a very steady business so I'm clearly not the only one who indulges in this guilty pleasure. If they bring back the Southwestern Chicken Burrito pizza I might have to come back and add another star.

CPK's "novelty" pizzas are indeed quite tasty, but it's not pizza imho. As such, I'll refrain from passing judgment with my jaded east coast eyes. The reason this place is deserving of 4 or 5 stars is because of the service. The first time I came here was on a Friday night in a group of 25. Receiving adequate service for a group that large despite all the hustle and bustle is commendable. The second time I visited with a group of 10, everyone ordered the honey wheat pizza crust only to find that CPK had run out. A manager came out to personally apologize. We ended up walking out with a heavy discount on our now normal-crusted pizzas and a few handfuls of coupons for frozen CPK pizza. Now THAT'S customer service.

I work nearby and this is conveniently located right by the 6th street pedestrian corridor.  It was a beautiful, sunny day last week when I decided to stop in here and get some Garlic Cream Fettucine to go.  The "to go" counter was very busy when I arrived but my turn came quickly.  The man working the counter had excellent customer service!!  He was very friendly and attentive, offering me a nice tall glass of ice water while I waited and then putting it in a cup to go so I could enjoy it on the walk back to the office.  He had my order ready within minutes.  The food was delicious!  I even had enough left to enjoy for dinner later that week.  The prices are a little high, but considering you can get a couple of meals out of it I don't mind every once in a while.  When I need a quick pasta or pizza during the week, this is my place!
Low rating is my fault I guess for not ordering the pizza. Mushroom ravioli is pretty bad here

I come here directly for their Waldorf salad!  It's the best I've ever had and it's huge...you may want to order the half. Their BBQ Chicken pizza is so good, I've been tempted to eat the whole thing myself...only my stomach would not allow it. The drinks are really good and variety is boundless.  Most recently I tried their cranberry mojito and it was crisp, tangy and had just enough kick you knew it was definitely illegal for the kids younger than 21. Good news: They are opening up one next to West-field Shopping Center (or as some of you old schoolers may call it: Southcenter!).

Pizza here is good but a little on the over priced side but still always solid. I really liked the newly introduced small bites menu. This alone to me is worth occasionally visiting the sweet corn ravioli is very tasty. The concept is very good and the prices are affordable. It was perfect because I wasn't feeling like a full meal but didn't want to split a plate with a friend or watch my friends eat. The only thing that bothers me about this place is I never feel the ambiance or the flavor of the pizzas warrant the $15 dollar price tag.
Their food is consistently delicious and the servers are all very friendly and attentive.

Had lunch here the other day and ordered the BBQ chicken salad. I love how fresh the salad tasted. They have chunks of chicken tossed with crisp tortilla strips,  corn, beans, with a light dressing and diced tomatoes.   The prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is really casual. Great place to take kids. The pizza looked pretty good. Might have to bring someone along next time...ps. The service was friendly and attentive, seating me quickly and taking my order in a timely fashion, for lunch getting me in and out is a must"
Love their chopped salad.  I always have fun when I go there.  Typically packed...and has been since the day they opened. cheers...Steve

If you are thinking about going to the California Pizza Kitchen, there is something you need to do before you leave the house. Take a look in your freezer and see if you have a frozen red Barron or a tombstone or something. Don't have one? Still want pizza? Go buy one. because at CPK you will spend over 10 dollars on five slices of crap. I had pepperoni because I don't get crazy with pizza, I just like the classics. It had no favor! Ew! Also....they had pepsi. suck. The service was good, but it didn't make the food taste better.

The service and the food both were excellent!  We had a group of 33 people and they didn't make a single mistake!  The general manager came and checked on our group often, and really made us feel like valued guests.  The wait staff was ON IT, keeping our drinks full and ensuring that all the orders were straight.  A great meal and great service made for a great evening!

I have eaten lunch and dinner here..The pizza-we had wild mushroom and tropical was good-sort of a pretentious west coast yuppie style-but not great.I prefer Topolino's close by-which has a more original garlicy seasoned flavor-New York style.  CPK is a light airy place and I understand why it is always busy.

My children love this place. The pizzas are just their size although not nearly the selection offered on the adult menu. The prices for the children's meals seem a bit high and yet they do have the most extensive kids menu ever seen. They love the kiwi flavored sodas and sundaes that come with their pizzas. I am a huge fan of the carne asada pizza. I always ask for extra peppers which truly makes it a spicy pizza. I don't recommend ordering a mixed drink. They are medium at best. Stick to wine or beer if you're in the mood for a little something to go along with dinner.  You will walk away satisfied.

We went out to celebrate Mother's Day last night. We decided to go to California Pizza Kitchen as it is "teen friendly"....my kids like the pizza there which is good for me so I don't have to hear complaints while I am enjoying my wine. When we arrived at 6ish there was a note on the door that said "No Pizza" which is odd since it is after all California PIZZA Kitchen. Well okay fine because we like pasta also and they make a decent sandwich. After waiting 20 minutes for a table we are seated. As we wait and wait and wait and wait for our water (another 20 minutes) our harried waitress takes our drink order. Then we wait and wait and wait and wait and she comes back (sans drinks) and asks for our order. My kids want pasta, she says that is fine but the wait for pasta is approx 30 minutes as the kitchen is backed up. I am thinking well maybe we should order a bottle of wine and have an appetizer. Then Wayne orders a sandwich, no they are out of bread and have no sandwiches, ok well what about the hummus plate, no they are out of pita. So what DID they have??? Salad and pasta with a minimum wait of 30 minutes. Me thinks they should have closed the doors and waited until they had the items on the menu. This is a chain after all..........but they did not and tried to make a buck. We said the buck stops here and we walked. What is surprising most of all is they did not TRY for our business. They should have at least comped an appetizer or something to put us in their good graces.....alas they did not. I received a$50.00 gift card for Mother's Day as a gift from my mom who did not want me to buy my Mother's Day dinner. I think I am going to put it on ebay.
