This is the nicest CPK I've been to! Much better than Northgate, SouthCenter, or DC. Very clean and spacious. The food took awhile to arrive and they didn't give us any bread! This made me a little grouchy :( My Hawaiian pizza was delicious and hit the spot. We ordered the chocolate soufflé, but it ended up being just a brownie and ice cream. Anyone who has tasted a soufflé knows what a letdown that is. I think when you go to CPK you should understand that it's not a traditional pizza joint, but more of a casual dining experience.

This is a see and be seen place at lunch time, especially in the summer. There is a patio and a constant stream of people walk past on their way to and from the mall. The prices are a little high for lunch, and the food is good, but not amazing. I agree with the other reviewer that the Thai pizza is pretty good.

I've had better pizza for way less. Here I think you pay more for the atmosphere than good pizza. But wait the atmosphere isn't that great either. I'll never go back here. I'd rather go to other pizza places.
The Jerk Chicken Pizza was really good, although it ended up being like $14 including tax and tip, which is kind of on the expensive side for lunch.  Bill Gates was sitting a few tables over.

This is a delightful restaurant across from the Bellevue Galleria Theaters and only a block from the Lincoln Square Theaters. Their pizzas are not your ordinary cheese and tomato sauce variety but the specialty variety like the Milan with Italian sausages, mushrooms, caramelized onions, Fontino, Mozzarella, and Parmesan cheeses, and herbs, or the Margharita. And don't forget their Barbeque Chicken Pizza. They also have a spicy Jambalaya with linguini pasta which is excellent. Their bar has about anything you could want including a good selection of beer both bottled and on tap. This place can get a little crowded, but there is excellent seating at the bar which works well if there are only 2 of you in your party.

Though I've visted several CPK's around the country, my aunt was a CPK virgin. So this was a mandatory stop on our trip. We ordered the BBQ chicken pizza & a cobb salad to split. Both were delicious & we couldn't eat all of the salad. Asked for more dressing as the salad needed it, but the toppings were plentiful. Strawberry lemonade tasted "instant".  Our waiter, Jessie, was friendly but disappeared for long periods of time. The bathrooms are downstairs & inconvenient. Look for a tall waiter who resembles Jimmy Smits - he's very nice too!
we went in there on newyears day for the 1st time and we became fan of their quesadillas..the pizza was delicious too..mexican blend in the pizza was really awesome..can't wait to go there again!!

As a vegetarian, all I can say is this place is paradise.  I am used to having only one or two choices in most non ethnic restaurants, but CPK has close to 10 menu items I can eat.  They even have a vegetarian split pea soup!!  I love the spagatini, the fussili with sun dried tomatoes and broccoli, the grilled veggie salad, the pita and hummus, the field greens salad, and this other thing I forget the name but it is sort of like brushetta.  It is always fresh, and the combination of flavors in their dishes burst with flavor.  Ever since I first had their split pea soup, I can never have canned or instant split pea soup again.  I also like some of their drinks, like the raspberry lemon drop, and they have a nice smooth sangria.  They are always busy on Friday and Saturday nights, so it is a long wait, but worth it!  I also like their management team, they are professional and really know how to take care of their staff and customers.

Took the wife and 3-year-old daughter here last Friday evening for some CPK.  They had one in Grapevine, Texas, when we lived near there a few years back, so I hadn't been to CPK in a while.  Not much had changed.  Still a very good menu, lots of variety.  Still a bit overpriced, which is part of what keeps me from rating it higher.  I had the Carne Asada pizza, and it was very good.  My daughter loved the water fountain out front, so much so that it was hard to get her to sit down and eat.  My only other complaint is that the place is pretty loud - high ceilings make for a lot of noise, especially on a Friday evening at about 7:00.  Service was a bit slow but that's to be expected in a very busy place.  On the plus side, they did validate parking (otherwise would have been $4), on the downside, they do not take the Prime Card.  All in all, not a bad experience, but for $35, there are better options.

CPK has often been my go-to place for lunch when i needed a break from the MS cafeteria salads (so bored of them!). I like their Vegetarian special (pizza with goat cheesewithout the japanese eggplant thogh-that tastes very blah on the pizza), their thai crunch salad (amazing!) and their recent new addition-the wonderfully crisp and fresh Miso salad. My only complaint: there was not a trace of avocado in the miso salad i ordered yesterday (and this is weird-because i have this one so often, i know it really well!). The edamame, cucumbers, subtle sweet and tangy dressing-all perfect except i sorely mr avocado. Especially because that is one of the key ingredients they list in the menu for this salad. Oh well-maybe they ran out of it one time. I also love sneaking a taste of hubby's favorite: the Mango Tandoori Chicken pizza (after i remove the chicken bits off it). Oh yeah-and they do have some great mojitos and their baked tortilla starters (with 3 choices of fillings) are super! My only problem with CPK is that it becomes a little boring every now and then. They don't update their menu too often (and when they do-they get rid of old favorites-like the pear an gorgonzola pizza that vanished unannounced!) and the ambience is so ho-hum.  I gotta say though: the quality of CPK food here in bellevue was wayy wayy better than the food i had at CPK Hollywood (or again- i just choose the wrong days to show up huh?!) Tip to avoid having a long wait at lunch: use their call-ahead service to get on the list 15 minutes before u expect to get there. They usually get you seated right away when you reach. ******Update: The Pear and Gorgonzola Pizza is back, and it is delish!!
